Description: This structured wine is tight, with a strong mineral texture to match the concentrated acidity and rich potential of the fruits. Almonds and layers of fruit and acidity indicate how this impressive wine will age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2019 L'Indigène Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Beautifully perfumed with ripe yellow fruits and almonds, this wine is richly concentrated and intense. Acidity shears through the wine at this young stage, adding to the structure and intensity. Age this wine and drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2019 La Coulée d'Argent Sec Montgouverne  (Vouvray)

Description: This wine has developed a nutty quality both in its aroma and its palate. Wood aging has brought in spice and a delicious balance between apple fruits and toastiness. Drink now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bois-Brinçon 2017 Les Saules de Montbenault Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: Light wood aging gives this wine extra richness. Yellow-fruit and honey flavors are delicious, with hints of almonds and a soft vanilla texture. The wine is rich while keeping all its freshness. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bois-Brinçon 2019 Terre de Grés Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: While this wine is labeled Sec (dry), the rich citrus and baked-apple flavors gives it a sumptuous feel. With ripe flavors and light acidity, the wine is tangily finished with lemon zest. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2020 La Coulée d'Argent Sec Montgouverne  (Vouvray)

Description: Matured on its lees to give extra richness, this wine is packed with mango and yellow fruits as well as citrus. A taste of honey hovers in the background of this wine. Drink from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de l'Enchantoir 2019 Terres Blanches  (Saumur)

Description: Honey hued and also intensely honeycomb on the nose, this wine offers a mingling with wet wool, candied ginger and grilled pineapple, the mouthfeel is rich, slippery and concentrated with a lovely lift of acidity to buoy it and a lingering tangy finish. Full throttle yet never forced, this walks to its own beat.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Millton 2018 Te Arai Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Gisborne)

Description: The green-apple freshness of this wine is perfumed and refreshing, with an elegant mouthfeel. The wine is fresh, textured and packed with fruitiness. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Mathieu Cosmé 2019 Les Promenards  (Vouvray)

Description: Off-dry can be a difficult style to pin down. But this wine has great balance, poised between touches of honey with mango fruitiness and zesty, mineral textures and acidity. The wine is young and its elements need to coalesce further. Wait to drink until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2020 La Bourdonnerie Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This is a bright, balanced wine from a variety that deserves more love in New Zealand. A radiant color, it offers plenty of varietal character in the form of red apple, ginger, honeysuckle, beeswax and wool. Aromas morph into flavors on a full figured palate that neatly balances fruit intensity with bright acidity, finishing on a spicy note. A fairly straightforward but crowd pleasing bottling.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Decibel 2019 Guinta by Daniel Brennan Chenin Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

Description: This off-dry wine brings out delicious honey and apple flavors with intense fruitiness and acidity. The clean and bright character makes it so appealing. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Pichot 2019 Peu de la Moriette Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: With the focus on red Cabernet Franc, it is sometimes forgotten that Chinon also produces white wine. This ripe, oak-aged wine with apple and spice flavors is luscious. Hints of mango give the wine an almost tropical character, while the more citrus aftertaste provides freshness. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Commanderie 2019 Elegance  (Chinon)

Description: This honeyed wine is full of ripe apples and attractive fruitiness. The texture is still a little young, but great fruit and a lively, mineral aftertaste are there. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Petit Coteau 2019 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: A ripe wine with warm yellow-fruit and pear flavors, this is already delicious. Acidity lines the wine, giving a fresh edge to the tangy, nutty fruit. The wine finishes with a hint of honey. Drink now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Mathieu Cosmé 2019 Fines Bulles  (Vouvray)

Description: Ripe with apple and honey flavors, this wine is fresh and crisp with acidity and touches of citrus. Age this bottling a short while for the nutty characters to emerge. Wait to drink until late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans NV Premium Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: Lemon-balm, apple-blossom and Asian pear aromas meet with a slightly waxy edge on the nose of this bottling. There's a line of lemon candy and richer apple that runs through the sip, with brushes of coconut flake and toasted nut on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chalone Vineyard 2018 Chenin Blanc (Chalone)

Description: There's a vibrant floral element to the bouquet of this pretty white, with supporting tones of freshly cut pear, peach and white melon. The palate is medium-full in feel, with a lovely rose-spiked peach accent that carries across the palate and is then refreshed by ample acidity. The finish ends clean and refreshing, with very good lingering vibrancy.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Lubanzi 2020 Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and richly textured wine offers subdued apple and baking-spice flavors that slowly build on the palate. Quite dry and well balanced, the wine feels broad and emphasizes nutty, toasty nuances in the flavors and finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: RD 2019 Fifth Moon Chenin Blanc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a tremendous display of rocky minerality on the nose of this bottling, which offers crushed granite, wet river stone and wet wool aromas, as well as a bright sense of lemon blossom. The chiseled stone character carries through the palate, where grippy tension frames lime pith and delicate honey flavors that emerge toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lieu Dit 2018 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Highlands District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp aromas of creamy pear, chiseled granite and a hint of pineapple show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in eastern Paso Robles. The palate is lively and florally aromatic without being overwhelming, offering restrained tuberose and plumeria flavors while clinging to a taut frame.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2019 Own-Rooted Shell Creek Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles Highlands District)

Description: This rich and mouthfilling wine from a producer that has long championed Chenin Blanc offers wonderfully subtle and layered flavors of baked apple, cream and nutmeg. Hints of vanilla, pear and peach emerge on the palate and linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lang & Reed 2019 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: This rich and fruity wine offers a distinctive blend of apricot, peach and mint flavors that are lifted by subtle acidity. The mouthfeel is soft if not quite sweet, leaving lingering fruit impressions on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sierra Del Mar 2019 Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: This fresh, fruity and smooth wine offers abundant fresh apple and melon flavors, medium body and a soft texture lifted by just a touch of appley acidity. It's a crowd-pleaser.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vinum Cellars 2018 CNW Cuvée Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: Butter and butterscotch aromas spill over to the palate, where buttery, toasted flavors come with a touch of tannin in this light-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rootdown 2018 Heringer Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Initially this doesn't give much away, eventually showing sharp aromas of melon and guava. The palate leans more blossomy, with slight elements of lemon and melon. It ends short and savory.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: One Woman 2019 Chenin Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: One of a pair of single-parcel wines from vineyards in the Vouvray area, this wine is tight, taut with acidy. Wood aging gives a lightly oxidative character as well as great baked apple, white fruit and peach flavors. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: La Taille aux Loups 2018 Venise Cuvée Parcellaire Monopole Chenin Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: The winery's signature white impresses once again in its grasp of green apple, mango and lime, the palate is both crisp and creamy with lively, fresh acidity and body weight. The minerality lifts and contrasts beautifully against the fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2019 Signature Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A luscious wine from a single parcel in the Vouvray region, this is smoothly textured, ripe with melon, chamomile tea and fine spice from wood aging. Its intense acidity balances the wine's honeyed character in a final medley of fruits and minerality. Drink from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: La Taille aux Loups 2018 Bretonnière Cuvée Parcellaire Monopole Chenin Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Chenin Blanc, well known in France's Loire Valley for its sweet quality, has honey and syrup flavors that are threaded through with lemon acidity and a mineral texture. The aftertaste brings out freshness to balance the sweetness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Colinas do Douro 2016 Colheita Tardia Chenin Blanc (Douro)

Description: This bold, deep-gold-colored, hazy, skin-contact wine offers earthy, hard-cider aromas, nervy apple and apricot flavors and a touch of tannin in the texture. Fermented with grape skins and juice together, it's a different expression of Chenin.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Divergent Vine 2019 Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: Single-vineyard wines are a specialty of this producer. This one from old vines is rich, concentrated and spicy. Barrel aging has added touches of nutmeg to enhance the white stone fruits and mineral-driven texture. The wine will be ready from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups 2018 Clos de Mosny  (Montlouis-sur-Loire)
Winery: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups

Description: This ripe, toasty wood-aged wine is concentrated, rich with baked apple, honey and textured acidity. The wine's toastiness is still forward and with its richness, minerality and generous fruitiness, it needs time. Drink from 2023. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups 2018 Les Hauts de Husseau  (Montlouis-sur-Loire)
Winery: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups

Description: Fermented and aged in wood, this wine has a good balance between fresh fruits and a denser, oxidative character. Almonds, cantaloupe melon and ripe acidity combine with the toastiness from the wood into a rich wine that is still developing. Drink from 2022 or even 2023. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups 2018 Clos du Hochet  (Montlouis-sur-Loire)
Winery: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups

Description: A proportioned and poised wine, this manages successfully to balance intense honeyed sweetness and well-honed acidity. Still young and with a great future ahead of it, the wine is already impressive. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs 2018 Le Bouchet Moelleux  (Vouvray)

Description: This is now a rich, mature Chenin Blanc. Its name indicates that fruit comes from the famed Clos du Papillon vineyard of Savennières, giving the wine ripeness and density. The acidity and quince flavors harmonize well. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Château de la Mulonnière L'Effet Papillon
Name: Saget la Perrière 2014 Château de la Mulonnière L'Effet Papillon  (Savennières)

Description: The toasty maturity of this rich wine is impressive. It balances the creamed apple and tight minerality by rounding and softening them, giving an elegant, spicy aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups 2008 Triple Zéro Millésimé  (Montlouis-sur-Loire)
Winery: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups

Description: Barrel aging gives this wine its creamy texture and underlines the apple flavors touched by almonds. Acidity and a mineral edge add freshness and structure. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups NV Triple Zéro Brut  (Montlouis-sur-Loire)
Winery: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups

Description: This beautifully textured wine is full of fruit and minerality. Yellow- and baked-apple flavors are tightly textured with acidity and hints of English walnuts. Ripe while light, this wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs 2018 Le Bouchet Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This rich, wood-aged wine is impressively structured, with ripe spice, almonds and an inspiring floral character. The round, supple texture and yellow fruits are generous. Although ready to drink, the wine will age at least until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Xavier et Agnès Amirault 2018 Les Quarterons Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of muscat gummy, mineral, toasted grape nuts and whiffs of tropical fruit. It's rounded in feel, with an exquisite sense of tension that the acid ratchets up through the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lobo Hills 2017 Roth Rock Farm Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Description: In keeping with the style of this producer's white wines, this is rich, spicy and peppery from alcohol while also having balanced fruit and acidity. It comes from a small parcel of old-vine Chenin Blanc on the estate. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Commanderie 2018 Cuvée Elégance  (Chinon)

Description: Baked-apple flavors come from this fruity wine. Lightly honeyed and with touches of lemon, it is young but already well balanced and refreshing.                      Roger Voss
Name: Complices de Loire 2019 Clair de Lune  (Montlouis-sur-Loire)

Description: Two years aging after the disgorgement has just begun the maturing process of this peach- and apple-flavored wine. It is zesty, the creamy mousse and acidity giving a final lift. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs NV Le Bouchet Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: This soft and generous wine has apple flavors and a pure line of acidity. The textured edge is still young and the wine will certainly age. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Petite Roche 2019 Origine Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: The honeyed flavors of Chenin Blanc sing in this attractive wine with its lemon acidity and pure, clean texture. This bottling is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups NV Brut Tradition Chenin Blanc (Touraine)
Winery: Domaine de la Taille aux Loups

Description: This ripe, nutty and creamy wine comes from an estate west of Angers. Smoothly textured and ripe, it has just a hint of bitterness that will disappear as it ages further. Give it until 2021 and it will have even greater smoothness and pleasure.                      Roger Voss
Name: Saget la Perrière 2018 M de Mulonnière Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: With flavors of nuts and apricots, this ripe wine has generous fruits and an open texture. Well structured, ripe and fruity, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Saget la Perrière 2018 Marie de Beauregard  (Vouvray)

Description: A lightly honeyed wine conveying apple sauce and ripe white stone fruits, this is attractive and fresh. A touch of minerality adds extra complexity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine A Deux 2019 Chenin Blanc (Touraine)

Description: Taut aromas of lime peel, lime blossom and cement show on the nose of this bottling of a grape that's pretty rare in this small appellation. There's a great crisp cut to the sip, where zesty lime and lemon-balm flavors enliven the palate with acid-driven energy.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Folktale 2019 Brosseau Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Chalone)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bone-dry despite the low alcohol, this tangy, delicious wine brings bright grapefruit, waxy lemon, apple and white peach goodness into focus. Almost unknown in Oregon, the potential here is limitless for this under-the-radar variety. Estate-grown and barrel-fermented with native yeast, this is a sappy, sexy and beautifully balanced wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Patton Valley 2019 Chenin Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Chenin Blanc is increasingly rare in the state, with this example coming from a warmer appellation. You'd never know it on the wine. The aromas are light and appealing, with notes of corn husk, mineral and whole lemon. The palate is medium-bodied, with tart acidity. It's a lovely example of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Succession 2019 Riverview Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Quite tangy but also concentrated, this medium-bodied wine blends crisp apple-peel flavors with ripe peaches for a mouthfilling, almost-sweet yet vibrant profile.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2019 D Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: Lots of apple and honey flavors and a nice nip of apple-skin astringency give great appeal and balance to this medium-bodied, barrel-fermented wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cardella 2019 Giuliana's Vineyard Chenin Blanc (California)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a new grape for this historic producer, and it comes from a historic source: 40-year-old vines at Curtis Vineyard. Aromas of lemon and grapefruit blossoms meet with crushed stone, wax and a core of yellow pear on the nose. There's a waxy tone to the sip, where a lemon-spiked almond-cream-sauce flavor lingers long.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calera 2018 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: There is a long-standing link between the Loire and Cahors with Chenin Blanc. This beautifully perfumed wine, with its baked apple and spice flavors, is generously textured. Acidity comes through the fine ripe fruits, giving a crisp balance at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2018 Chenin de Mercuès Chenin Blanc (Côtes du Lot)

Description: Very fruity and rather light bodied, this fresh-tasting wine comes off as slightly sweet, offering cotton-candy aromas and fruit-cocktail flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2018 Chenin Blanc (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and crisp, there is a pinpoint florality on the nose of this bottling, which shows lemon blossom, yellow pear and kumquat on the nose. Loads of tangy and energetic citrus flavors pop on the palate, where more kumquat leads into a broader sense of apple flesh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Notary Public 2017 Jurassic Park Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This attractive, technically light-bodied wine fermented in a concrete egg is rich in ripe fruit flavors and has a mouthcoating texture, but stays nicely balanced thanks to underlying acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dashe Cellars 2019 Les Enfant Terrible Concrete Cuvée Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Plenty of ripe fruits like honeydew melon and yellow peach give a generous expression to this full-bodied wine, and a big smooth texture wraps it all up. Best through 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: T. Berkley Wines 2018 Norgard Farms Chenin Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a variety change for this wine. Coming from vines planted in 1970, the aromas are light, with notes of herb, honey and mineral. The palate shows an appealing sense of precision, detail and balance. The bright acidity of the variety shines throughout.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Efeste 2019 Adrienne Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright and fresh, with notes of citrus zest, lemon balm and tangerine. The palate is sleek and juicy, with passion fruit flavors and bright acidity. There's a lot to like.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Convergence Zone 2019 Sunbreak Upland Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Snipes Mountain)

Description: This exciting wine is crisp and tangy, full of vivid fruit flavors like kiwi, lime and green apple. Good acidity gives it a lively, appetizing mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Aperture 2019 Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of cut, slightly oxidized seeming red apple, along with plentiful notes of pear. A licorice note lurks in the background. The palate is textured in feel. It brings the acidity this variety is known for.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Fielding Hills 2019 Estate Chenin Blanc (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Gorgeously textured, swinging between unctuousness and freshness, this is a soulful wine from New Zealand's godfather of biodynamics, James Millton. Millton's reputation for Chenin Blanc is equally mighty, and this honey-hued beauty lives up to it in every way. Highly aromatic, like a flower garden, it offers heady scents of jasmine, hyacinth and lavender combining with raw honeycomb, guava and pineapple rind.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Millton 2017 Te Arai Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Gisborne)

Description: Relatively new to the scene, Black Estate has made a big splash with its stripped-back, site-expressive wines from organic and biodynamic vineyards in North Canterbury. The color of melted butter, this Chenin is intensely evocative, like a rainy autumn day. There's honeyed pear, yeasty apple, fig, buttercup, beeswax, ground nutmeg and layers of minerals. The palate is equally mineral-driven and texturally complex yet linear. There's a slight funk on the finish, but it doesn't distract from the beauty of this characterful wine.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Black Estate 2017 Home Chenin Blanc (North Canterbury)

Description: Winemaker: Bruwer Raats. This smells super fresh, pristine and pure, with moderate aromas of fresh pear slices, just-ripe honeydew, lightly honeyed apple slices, ripe orange and quince, coupled with delicate hints of fresh pressed fynbos and sweet grass. The palate is smooth and medium in weight, with rich orchard fruit and citrus tones that are partnered with lightly toasted straw and melon rind characteristics. Beautifully balanced, with bright acidity, a mineral streak and a long, evolving finish. Drink now through 2028.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Designation: Cape Winemakers Guild The Fountain Terroir Specific
Name: Raats Family 2019 Cape Winemakers Guild The Fountain Terroir Specific Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Winemaker: Pierre Wahl. This is quite toasty and oaky upfront right now, with pronounced aromas of wood-grilled apple, orange oil, custard and yellow melon. The palate is full and weighty, but not fat, with plush, mouth-filling toasted-fruit flavors that have a decadent, grilled edge and lingering impressions of sweet spice and toast on the finish. Impressions of yellow apple, musk melon, sweet braised fennel, straw and pie crust carry through on the close, with a kiss of honey on the way back as well as the lingering warmth of toasty baking-spice characteristics.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Rijk's 2018 Cape Winemakers Guild CWG Chenin Blanc (Tulbagh)

Description: Wood aging has given this smooth wine great complexity that, after five years, has matured into richness, intensity and amazing freshness. Apple flavors are still intact, softened into a medley of perfumes and acidity. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Juchepie 2015 Le Clos de Juchepie Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: From one of the best-known vineyards in Savennières, this rich wine is packed with yellow fruits laced with citrus and almond flavors. The richness is still young and vibrant with acidity. With time the wine will deepen and become more concentrated. Drink from 2021. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Closel 2018 Clos du Papillon  (Savennières)

Description: A rich, honey and almond-flavored wine, this is deliciously ripe. The acidity and crisp apple fruits of this young wine are heightened by the taut, steely texture as well as the complex aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: La Chapelle Vieilles Vignes Chenin Sec
Name: Château de Fesles 2017 La Chapelle Vieilles Vignes Chenin Sec Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: This dry wine comes from organically grown grapes in a single old-vine parcel. With enormous potential, the wine is superbly ripe, showing white fruits as well as minerality, a taut texture and acidity that will soften. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2017 Le Clos  (Vouvray)

Description: Laurent and Stéphane Gouron fermented this wine in large oak barrels in their historic tuffeau caves. The result is a smooth and beautifully ripe wine. Intense and luscious, it boasts generous yellow fruits and perfumed pears. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gouron 2018 Cuvée la Croix Boissée  (Chinon)

Description: This wine was fermented in the bottle only, in the old style. Bone dry, the wine has a wonderful nutty character, shot through with acidity that is now calmed down and forms part of the white-fruit element. Elegant and ripe, it is ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2016 L'Ancestrale Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: Matured in clay amphora for a year, this smooth wine offers both refreshing acidity and a light touch of oxidation that adds complexity. Now well balanced between acidity and rich fruit, the wine is totally ready to drink. Biodynamic                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Juchepie 2017 Le Jarre de Juchepie Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: Named after the parcel on which the vines are planted, this wine is richly dense. Wood aging has added butter and toastiness to the opulent white-fruit flavors. Beautifully rich, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gouron 2017 Cuvée la Croix Boissée  (Chinon)

Description: This is a beautifully fruity wine from Eric Santier. It is ripe, with a lasting taste of apricots, smooth cantaloupe melons and a shot of acidity. The wine is dense and richly textured, hinting at honey at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Dozon 2018 Le Saut au Loup  (Chinon)

Description: Produced from 30-year-old vines and fermented in old barrels, this wine has considerable richness. Its creamy texture balances baked-apple flavors with vibrant acidity and indicates this is still a fresh, young wine. It is great to drink now for its urgency, but will also age into a more mature Chenin Blanc range of flavors and be drinkable from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Gaverie 2016 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Aged in wood for one year, this is a perfectly mature Chenin Blanc. Richness and delicious freshness brings out a mix of yellow fruits, creamed apples and just a touch of spice. This biodynamic wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Juchepie 2017 Les Monts de Juchepie Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: Right at the dry end of the useful scale on the back label of the bottle, this wine is, however, soft and full of fruit. With its acidity still developing, the wine's future is assured. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2018 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Creamy and crisp with a fruity core of apple and pear, this wine is seamless in neutral oak, which adds to a balanced body weight and texture. Inviting aromas of honeysuckle permeate from start to finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lola 2018 Chenin Blanc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pristine aromas of candied mango, cherimoya, chalk and citrus pith makes for a very engaging nose on this bottling. The palate begins with a pithy tone, strong acidity and lots of texture, allowing ripe red apple, pear and white-flower blossom flavors to shine.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2017 Curtis Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Produced from ungrafted vines planted in 1979, this wine is ripe, with pear and white-peach flavors. Gentle acidity and a touch of nuttiness bring good balance to the wine from an innovative producer. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Henry Marionnet 2018 Vinifera Chenin Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of dried apple and pear, orange peel, elderflower and beach sand show on the nose of this tasty white wine. There's an extremely textural tone of grapefruit pith on the palate, with a warmer hint of blanched almond as well.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Foxen 2018 Ernesto Wickenden Vineyard Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: Produced from some of the domaine's young vines, this wine is soft, ripe and full of baked-apple and spice flavors. It is rich while still having plenty of young freshness. The wine needs no aging and its beautiful balance makes it very ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Closel 2018 La Jalousie  (Savennières)

Description: This is a fun and fruity white wine at a remarkably fair price, abundant in aromas of honeysuckle and honey. Sleek in texture and high in acidity, it winds together layers of fig, blood orange and pear.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Delta 2019 Chenin Blanc (California)

Description: This dry sparkling wine relies on the natural ripeness of the Chenin Blanc for its rounded character. Acidity is very present, giving a wine that has texture, crisp apple flavors and a creamy mousse. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême NV Cuvée T Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: A dry Chenin Blanc now maturing well, this wine offers spice, nuttiness and orange-zest flavors. It is full of acidity as well as zestiness, with a rich backdrop of yellow fruits. Like any fine Chenin Blanc, it could well age further, and should be at its best from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Fesles 2017 La Chapelle Vieilles Vignes Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: Sliced green-apple flavors come through strongly in this ripe wine. Richness comes from ripe grapes that give intense fruit flavors as well as a bite of pepper. Although young, the wine it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Famille Duveau 2019 Brézé  (Saumur)

Description: This slightly off-dry wine is ripe with delicious nectarine and kiwi flavors. Its balance is just right, poised between freshness and rich fruitiness. A touch of honey adds a soft aftertaste. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Montfort 2018 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Fruits and acidity shine in this crisp, young wine that has a bright citrus and green-apple character. Vibrant acidity is delicious at the finish. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Guilloterie 2019 Elégance Brézé  (Saumur)

Description: Light honey and ripe almonds permeate this off-dry wine. It is young, the ripe Chenin Blanc fruit not yet fully expressive. Expect creamed apple and spice to come out over the next few months. Drink from now                      Roger Voss
Name: Bougrier 2018 Famille Bougrier  (Vouvray)

Description: This wine has a bouquet of apple and green pear. It is bright in the mouth, with flavors of peach and apricot and a hint of jasmine that coalesce in a tangy finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Sula 2019 Estate Bottled Chenin Blanc (Nashik)

Description: From organically grown grapes, this wine is ripe, with a lively texture plus hints of tropical fruits and almonds. The wine is bone dry, its dryness mitigated by ripe baked-apple and pear flavors. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Petit Coteau 2016 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This tensely crisp wine is full of acidity that is balanced by white-stone-fruit flavors. Bone dry, the wine has a nutty, softer edge that gives it a warm potential. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2018 Spring  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A soft, creamy wine with baked-apple and almond flavors, this is immediately attractive. Lightly perfumed and with a rounded texture, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Fournier Père et Fils 2019 Mmm? Grande Cuvée de Fournier Chenin Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: This medium-sweet Vouvray brings out almonds, baked apples and a soft texture. An easy, fruity wine, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Aimé Boucher 2018  Vouvray

Description: This unfocused medium-dry wine is ready to drink. Mild acidity and soft fruit flavors make it simple and lightly structured.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bougrier 2018 V Douce France  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is consistently one of the best values from the state or the country for that matter. The aromas leap up, with notes of passion fruit, guava and kiwi. The palate is broad and flavorful, with vibrant, mouthwatering acidity. It's a stylistic shift from recent vintages, with the coolness of the season and October frost making it considerably more nervy and edgy.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2019 Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of whole honeydew melon and pear lead to tangy, lightly spritzy, off-dry flavors that show a lot of intensity. The acidity is lovely, upping the interest. It needs some time to full settle in, but it has all of the stuffing.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kiona 2019 Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Chenin Blanc is increasingly rare in the state, with this example coming from old vines planted in the late 1970s. Candied banana, apple, wet stone, honeycomb and white peach aromas are followed by medium-plus bodied flavors and a slightly warn finish. An intriguing sense of acidity stands it up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2019 Proprietor's Reserve Roza Hills Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From dry-farmed vines planted in 1971, this is a tremendous example of the potential for Chenin Blanc. Waxy aromas of paraffin, lemon peel, dried pear flesh and even Rainier cherry lead into an extremely grippy texture on the palate. Flavors of dried lemon and pear lead into a waxy, slight vanilla character on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lone Madrone 2018 Chenin Blanc (Adelaida District)

Description: An opulent, rich and honeyed wine, this has great sweetness sustained by the dry core of botrytis. It is gorgeously textured with bitter orange and apricot flavors imbued with pure acidity that keeps the balance in place. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Designation: La Coulée d'Or Grande Année Moelleux
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2018 La Coulée d'Or Grande Année Moelleux  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This wine is approaching maturity. Ripe apple and almond flavors have softened and opened up, giving intensity. Biodynamically grown grapes bring all their flavors together in a beautiful wine, created by Anne-Claude Lefaive and continued by husband, Christian Jacques, in her memory. It can be drunk now but will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clau de Nell 2016 Chenin Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: From a south-facing vineyard, this sumptuous, floral wine offers ripe tropical fruits and balanced acidity. The mineral edge shows through in a wine that is beautifully textured. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Loïc Mahe 2018 Sables et Schistes  (Savennières)

Description: As the color of this wine moves towards a golden stage, it loses fruit but gains in intensity and beautiful secondary flavors. The wine's balance brings in touches of toastiness as well as a hint of pepper. A rich wine that finishes with great acidity, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2015 L'Oppidum Sec  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This biodynamic estate was started in 2008 by Anne-Claude Leflaive and continued by her husband, Christian Jacques. But its history is the soil they recognized as perfect for excellent Chenin Blanc. This wine captures intense fruit and lemon and almond flavors, with a touch of oxidation that opens everything up. Drink this still-young wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clau de Nell 2017 Chenin Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: Now mature, this ripe wine has rich white fruits balanced by layers of spice, almonds and cool acidity. This floral, perfumed wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2015 La Coulée d'Argent Montgouverne Sec  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a newly planted estate vineyard, this is the first Chenin Blanc from Edna Valley in a long time, and it's a treat. Aromas of Meyer lemon peel, wax, honeysuckle and light peach lead into a rich expression of lemon blossom, tart apple and lush pear.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Center of Effort 2018 Oro Bianco Chenin Blanc (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy lemon and grapefruit peel aromas meet with white-fleshed pome fruit on the nose of this organically grown wine. A grippy structure frames dried citrus peel and wax-like flavors that fluctuate from sharp to rich.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Coquelicot 2018 Estate Chenin Blanc (Los Olivos District)

Description: Now golden in color, this wine with orange-marmalade aromas and honeyed texture is fully mature, although it will keep for many years. It offers flavors of orange peel and ginger, still with acidity in the background. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2015 La Coulée d'Or Moelleux  (Vouvray)

Description: Before you even get to the wine, take a weight-lifting course for the massive bottle. When finally poured, the wine is rich, full of nutty fruit flavors as well as pepper and spice. This generous wine with an exciting texture will be ready from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2018 L'Indigène Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: A good balance between baked-apple fruit and honeyed acidity gives this dry wine a spicy shape. The wine is only just mature showing how great Chenin Blanc can age. Drink now, but preferably wait until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2017 La Coulée d'Argent Montgouverne Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This wood-aged wine is beautifully mature. Ripe fruits are now fully sublimated into richness while keeping some acidity. The wine's rounded character, almond and spice flavors are still lifted by acidity. This textured wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble Brisebarre 2015 Cuvée Amédie Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This off-dry Chenin Blanc is ripe and gently sweet. With acidity and apricot and spice flavors, the wine is rich, full and packed with acidity as well as a honeyed flavor. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2018 La Bourdonnerie Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This generous wine comes from a south-facing single parcel. The rounded character and touches of honey are balanced by a lightly herbal backdrop. The wine will age and will be best from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Guilloterie 2017 Les Perruches  (Saumur)

Description: This fruity wine is mineral, packed with delicious citrus, quince and pear flavors. It's an aromatic wine, full of fruitiness with a delicate mousse. Drink this bottling now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moncontour 2016 Cuvée Prédilection  (Vouvray)

Description: Bone dry, this wine offers richness as well as bitter-almond and ripe apple flavors. Still young, it has a tight edge and intense acidity. The wine shows great potential, so let it age. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2018 Montgouverne Grande Année Sec  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Chenin Blanc is disappearing in Washington, and this wine is a testimony to what the state stands to lose. The aromas are vibrant, with notes of peach, fig and beeswax. Medium-bodied, textured tropical flavors follow, persisting on the finish. It's a complete delight and shows a lot of staying power. Drink now, or put some in the cellar.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cedergreen Cellars 2017 Old VIne Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is full of ripe apple, baked pear and almond flavors. Bone dry, the wine brings out considerable acidity to keep the ripe fruit in balance. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2017 L'Indigène Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: In this wine the balance between lemon fruits and light sweetness is impeccable. Fruity with baked apple flavors, it's lightly textured, perfumed and worth aging. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moncontour 2019 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: With a tannish gold color and dusty aromas of melon, peach and apricot, this lighter-bodied Chenin feels a touch cidery and braced by malic acidity. Peach and nectarine flavors finish steady. This is living proof that Chenin Blanc is alive and well in Argentina, even if it's a rarity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Gen Del Alma 2019 Jijiji Gen Fuerza Tanquila Chenin Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: This wine is just approaching maturity, with its apple flavors beginning to get a toast and honey character. It is smooth while also having intense acidity and a lemon-zest edge. Drink this well-structured, mineral-textured wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble Brisebarre 2016 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: A burnished gold color and dry aromas of apricot and papaya open this 11.2% abv Chenin Blanc that's more linear than layered on the palate. Apple and just-ripe nectarine flavors hold on nicely across a finish that's medium in intensity. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Michelini i Mufatto 2017 Propósitos Gerardo Michelini Chenin Blanc (Mendoza)

Description: A ripe wine softened with one year's aging, this is rich, full of creamed apple and hazelnut flavors. The acidity, broadened and well balanced, brings out the crisp aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Petite Roche 2018 Origine Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: The Duveau family estate has been in the same ownership since 1835. The wine, named after the vineyard's village, is well textured, smoothly ripe and packed with white fruit. A mineral edge adds a touch of crispness to the rounded character. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Famille Duveau 2018 Brézé  (Saumur)

Description: Still a little young, this wine is at a stage between fresh fruit and maturity. It needs to age to bring out the honey, lemon and mature nutty quality. Keep this wine until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble Brisebarre 2017 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: In this classic, sweeter style of Chenin Blanc, honey and botrytis characteristics are lifted by vibrant acidity. The wine balances both sweetness and freshness, and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2018 La Levrière Grande Année Moelleux  (Vouvray)

Description: Crisp and lightly honeyed, this is a fruity wine. The light texture and a nutty element give the wine complexity to balance its freshness. Let the wine develop a few more months and drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Petite Roche 2019 Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: This wine has an attractive nutty quality that pairs with hints of honey and white fruits. Texture adds a tang. It finishes with acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Compagnie Vinicole de Val de Loire 2017 Le Petit Perroy  (Vouvray)
Winery: Compagnie Vinicole de Val de Loire

Description: This softly ripe wine with a creamy mousse is immediately attractive. The nutty, spicy texture balances with a fresher, more mineral character to give a wine that is deliciously ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble Brisebarre NV Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: This crisp wine offers creamed-apple flavors along with acidity and a slightly bitter edge that will vanish. It has total freshness and will certainly age and fill out. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Guilloterie 2018 Brézé Elégance  (Saumur)

Description: This soft, lush wine shows earthy, buttery aromas, rich fig and pear flavors and a broad texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Toca Madera 2018 Laurie's Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Madera)

Description: This attractive, medium-dry wine comes from a historic estate with remarkable gardens. Hints of honey and almonds balance with baked-apple flavors for a poised, eminently drinkable wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Valmier 2017  Vouvray

Description: This off-dry Vouvray is nutty and with a hint of honey. Creamed apples and crushed cookies are balanced by tight acidity that goes right through the wine. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: La Garenne 2019  Vouvray

Description: This dry Vouvray comes from a single vineyard. Ripe apples combine with lime acidity to give a fruity, fresh wine. Brightness and a crisp aftertaste make the wine ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Paul Buisse 2018 Clos du Gaimont  (Vouvray)

Description: An attractive, spicy and lemony wine, this is off dry in style. Softly textured, hinting at honeyed fruits, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Montfort 2019 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Buttery aromas and baked apple flavors give this medium-bodied wine an indulgent, almost-sweet expression. It offers soft acidity and a plush texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Paskett 2018 Hoffman Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Lodi)

Description: This dry wine shows honey and spice more than fruit. Almost too old, it is beginning to dry out and gain oxidative elements while the toastiness is becoming more prominent. Drink immediately.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Bourillon d'Orléans 2014 L'Oppidum Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This wine offers hints of the floral, honey flavor typical of Chenin Blanc. But that gets lost in the bitter walnut tastes that hide the wine's attractiveness.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Fontaines 2016 Les Blanderies Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: This is an interesting, unusual, mature and nutty-tasting wine. Aromas of toasted walnuts and wood smoke are followed by mild butter and poached pear flavors for a rich but not overripe character.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Stockman 2018 Laurie's Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Madera)

Description: Aromas of pear and orange blossom excite the palate for a sophisticated mélange of green apple, almond and vanilla flavors that fuse into a lingering custard finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Netofa 2017 Latour Chenin Blanc (Galilee)

Description: This dry and complex wine offers gentle aromas of white flowers, crisp celery and green apple followed by a tangy white-peach flavor. Lifted acidity lends great balance in this rather light-bodied, bright and delicious offering.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2018 Dry Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy lemon-peel and sliced green-pear aromas kick off the nose on this block-designated bottling from a popular source of Chenin Blanc. It's tightly wound and tart on the palate with lime and grapefruit peel as well as sour apple, proving pleasantly crisp.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zanoli 2018 Jurassic Park Vineyard Block CW-X1 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Strong butter and caramel aromas dominate this medium-bodied, low-alcohol, apple and lemon-flavored wine. It combines a sense of breadth and richness without being too ripe.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rootdown 2018 Heringer Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: This soft, nutty-flavored wine also has plenty of crisp apple acidity and a tight, nervy texture. It is still young and needs to age. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Pinsonnière 2017 Brut  (Vouvray)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a pretty mix of pineapple rind, honeycomb wax and lemongrass on the nose of this white. There's a nice roundness to the feel, yet sour lemon and lime flavors dominate the palate and ultimately win out.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paumanok 2018 Dry Chenin Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Crisp with nutty flavors alongside the fresh acidity and citrus accents, this is an unusually dry wine for a Vouvray. Clean and brightly fruity, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bougrier NV Pure Loire Brut  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a sharpness on the nose in aromas of white balsamic, pineapple and lemon. Sweet orchard fruit flavors kick off the palate, with mild acidity chiming in for balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bellangelo 2017 Chenin Blanc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Outer Coastal Plain, New Jersey, US
Description: An unusual deep golden color and intriguing marigold, brie and orange aromas make for a complex sparkling Chenin. The palate combines golden honey and honey crisp apple with hints of dried apricot and dried flowers. Time in the glass reveals nutty hazelnut and almond tones. Baking spice creeps in at the close extending the finish on this bewildering and delicious pét nat.                      Fiona Adams
Name: William Heritage 2018 Pét-Nat Chenin Blanc (Outer Coastal Plain)

Description: Medium bodied and just a touch sweet, this wine overflows with ripe apple and melon aromas, and broad rich appley and floral flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2018 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: A simple citrus note blends apple and fresh hay aromas. Tingling apple and Mandarin orange notes ride supertart acidity loaded with lemon juice and a long lime finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Arterra 2018 Fauquier County Chenin Blanc (Virginia)

Appellation: Paso Robles Highlands District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very tight aromas of wet stone, light white flowers and Asian pear flesh show on the always appealing nose of this bottling by Sherman Thacher, one of the white-wine highlights from Paso Robles each vintage. The grippy wine grabs hold of the palate with a chalky texture and very dry white-fruit flavors, proving tense throughout the sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2018 Shell Creek Vineyard Own-Rooted Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles Highlands District)

Description: Fresh apple and orange-blossom aromas lead to crisp and satisfying fruit flavors in this light-bodied, fresh and appetizing wine. It feels well balanced on the palate and turns a bit soft or sweet on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2018 Prince Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: This rich wine offers aromas of honeyed nuts, oyster shell, apples, pears and a slight charred character. The palate is creamy in feel and shows prominent oak influence, but it doesn't overpower.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Streicker 2017 Ironstone Block Chenin Blanc (Margaret River)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Apple and golden-pear aromas are cut by lemon peel on the nose of this bottling. There is a fresh zip on the sip, with yellow-peach and melon flavors making for a bright flavorful wine.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dubost 2018 Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: Growing Chenin Blanc has a long tradition in the Cahors region. Along with its nutty character and red-apple flavors, this wine has a mineral texture that gives tension to balance the ripe fruitiness. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Chenin de Mercuès Chenin Blanc (Côtes du Lot)

Description: A bouquet of lemongrass and thyme leads to flavors of toasted pineapple, lemon, vanilla and rose petal. This wine is bright on the palate and has a soft floral finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Sula 2018 Estate Bottled Chenin Blanc (Nashik)

Description: Freshly cut red-apple aromas lead to off-dry, but leaning sweeter full-bodied fruit flavors. It doesn't have the acid to stand up to the sugar but will still have an audience.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cellardoor 2017 Chenin Blanc (America)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is very reductive on the nose, with lemon rinds barely able to get past the closed-in nose. There is tension to the palate, but the flavors reflect the nose, offering just a bit of citrus.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Purple Dragon 2018 Jurassic Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This intense, full-bodied wine is full of baked-apple and cooked-pear flavors. There is certainly acidity here, but it is integrated in the wine's ripeness and weight. The perfumed, nutty aftertaste is as full as the rest of this rich wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2018 Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: Waxy peach, green apple and lemon zest make for an enticing entry into this signature wine, which is lively and complex in crisp acidity. It builds body and weight on the midpalate, offering a creamy texture of viscous tropical richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2018 Signature Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Coteaux du Layon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This golden-colored wine is concentrated, with flavors of ripe botrytis, bitter-orange marmalade and spice, plus great acidity. Ripe apricots give richness to this impressive, now mature wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2015 Cuvée Maxence Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

Description: Crisp and pleasant aromas of nectarine, white flower and guava make for a sort of tropical sorbet on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp, with flavors of Asian pear and rounded nectarine wrapped in a stiff chalky texture and racy acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bold 2018 Vista Verde Chenin Blanc (Paicines)

Description: This superrich wine is a dense expression of ripe Chenin Blanc. Baked-apple flavors are lit by acidity while having powerful pepper and spice flavors. The concentration and mineral texture of the wine are impressive. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Hardières 2017 Terroir de Schistes Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are effusive, with notes of banana, papaya, herb, kiwi and fresh pineapple. Ripe, fuller-feeling tropical fruit flavors follow with enough acidity to stitch it all together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Coteaux du Layon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This sweet wine shows such fine acidity that it plays toward fresh. Touches of honey go with apricots and some botrytis to give a wine that wears its richness lightly. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2017 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

Description: This sophisticated wine offers flavors of crisp apples and almonds. It is bone dry, which means it needs to age in bottle in order to soften, but all the elements are there, with a fresh twist of lemon at the end.                      Roger Voss
Name: Monmousseau NV L'Essentiel Brut Zéro Chenin Blanc (Touraine)

Appellation: Coteaux du Layon, Loire Valley, France
Description: A medium-sweet wine from the Layon Valley, famed for rich noble-rot wines, this has a touch of honey plus acidity and baked-apple fruitiness. It is ready to drink although it will develop and will be better from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de la Roulerie 2018 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Ice wines are a rarity in the state. Aromas of muscat gummy, honey and herbs lead to sweet, honeyed flavors. It doesn't hit the heights of recent vintages, but there is still a lot to like.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kiona 2018 Estate Grown Ice Wine Chenin Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: Lightly wood aged in older barrels, this wine has a poised character. With citrus filled out with spice and tangy acidity, the wine is lightly structured and fresh. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Xavier Frissant 2018 Les Pierres Chenin Blanc (Touraine Amboise)

Description: A soft, lightly nutty wine with attractive acidity, this has delicious, ripe-apple flavors. It is fruity, perfumed and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Paris-Simoneau NV Brut Blanc Chenin Blanc (Touraine)

Description: With a good blend of white-currant and apple flavors, this wine is dry, with a nutty edge. Ripeness gives it a juicy character and emphasizes the wine's potential. It is still young and will be better from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de la Roulerie 2018 Chenin Blanc Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This gentle, fruity wine is attractive with acidity as well as pear and melon flavors that are softened with toasted almonds. Full of easy fruit and juicy acidity, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clement et Florian Berthier 2018 Chenin Chenin Blanc (Val de Loire)

Description: Winemaker: Sebastian Beaumont. There are serious orange oil, chamomile and lanolin characteristics to the nose of this white, with additional, equally pronounced tones of waxy yellow melon, cedar-grilled apple and some caramel corn, though the latter is not obnoxiously so. A sweet wheat and slight honeyed accent unfolds on the medium-weight palate, too, though with a bright thread of acidic nerve and pithy, tannic texture to cut through the ripe fruit tones.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Designation: Cape Winemakers Guild Leo's Whole Bunch
Name: Beaumont 2017 Cape Winemakers Guild Leo's Whole Bunch Chenin Blanc (Bot River)

Description: Winemaker: Bruwer Raats. This smells bright and clean, with medium-intense aromas of crisp Anjou pear, white melon, fresh grain and just a touch of beeswax. The palate is light and direct, with a thread of acidity streaking through the tart pear, lime, green plum and melon flavors. It's balanced and refreshing, with nice verve through the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Designation: Cape Winemakers Guild The Fountain Terror Specific
Name: Raats Family 2018 Cape Winemakers Guild The Fountain Terror Specific Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Winemaker: Frans Smit. Baked apple, honeycomb, gingered peach and orange oil lead the nose of this ripe, almost sweet-smelling white. The palate offers more of those ripe fruit tones and a delicate white-floral character, though with a lightly tannic structure that provides great textural depth and grounds the more pronounced floral tone and ripe fruit flavors that dominate the finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Designation: Cape Winemakers Guild Farm House Organic
Name: Spier 2017 Cape Winemakers Guild Farm House Organic Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Soft and supple in peach and lemon, this lovely white is fleshy in texture with plenty of underlying acidity to keep it fresh in the glass. It saw time in stainless steel and neutral oak, and persists in aromas of jasmine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Delta 2018 Chenin Blanc (California)

Description: Entirely varietal from estate-grown fruit, Betty's shows fig, peach and apple flavors wrapped around a stony texture of midweight ripeness and style. Floral, it's youthfully vibrant.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ballentine 2018 Betty's Vineyard Chenin Blanc (St. Helena)

Description: Lovely melon and freshly sliced apple aromas lead to crisp fruit flavors that are tangy and tempting in this light- to medium-bodied wine. It is absolutely refreshing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vinum Cellars 2017 CNW Cuvée Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Funky aromas of sour orange, flint, yeast and damp campfire are almost cider-like on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tangy with apple, dried lemon-peel and burned toast flavors, framed by a crunchy squeaky texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Combe 2017 Cuvée August Chenin Blanc (Ballard Canyon)

Description: A light, toasty accent wafts from the glass upon first sniff of this beautiful white, transitioning into aromas of grilled apple, dried apple slices, lemon wax, fresh beeswax, lemon basil and orange blossom. The palate is stunning, with a superb texture that wraps around the just-ripe citrus, orchard fruit and bitter melon flavors. It's superbly balanced, with notes of wood spice, field flowers, lemongrass and fynbos that dance throughout the evolving and lingering finish. While it's a stunner now, it should age gracefully through 2029.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2017 Huilkrans Chenin Blanc (Citrusdal Mountain)

Description: Lemon balm, cinnamon bark, yellow field flowers, spiced orange tea, just-dried straw and lightly toasted apple skin all dance on the nose of this ethereal and superbly attractive wine. The mouthfeel is fruited and rounded yet balanced and textured all at once, with a lovely bitterness and a lick of salted butter that play against the ripe orchard and citrus fruit flavors. Lingering notes of waxy melon, orange rind and whole spice like nutmeg and allspice unfold on the long, lightly nutty finish. It's a charmer that's hard to resist but will age well through 2030.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2017 Magnetic North Chenin Blanc (Citrusdal Mountain)

Description: There's an immediate spicy, floral character at play here, like ginger mixed with orange blossom and lemon peel tea, alongside notes of spiced pear and musk melon. The palate is fresh and vibrant, with precise acidity that lifts the palate and gives superb cut to the ripe fruit tones. The texture is layered and refined, as waves of fruit, then acidity, then pithy astringency dance across your palate and lead into an enduring, evolving finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2017 Nautical Dawn Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This is very likely the last release of this single-vineyard wine, after winemakers Chris and Suzaan Alheit found the extreme Bottelary site unrecoverable after three years of drought pushed it over the edge. Shame, but it's a beautiful swan song, boasting pure, direct notes of calendula, beeswax, fynbos and Anjou pear from the start. The palate shows good cut, with moderate acidity and a softly pithy texture reminiscent of bitter melon, orange peel and pear. The finish lingers on a saline accent.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2017 Radio Lazarus Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Aromas of lemon thyme, white tea, calendula, white melon and spiced yet snappy pear abound on the complex, earthy nose of this wine. The palate is plush and generous, filling the mouth on all sides with each sip, but is then countered by vibrant acidity and framed by soft wood tannin and citrus peel astringency to support the generous flavors. The finish is long and evolving, from wood to fruit to earth. A super tasty and well-balanced pour. Enjoy now–2029.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: DeMorgenzon 2017 Reserve Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: On first sniff, a soft wood note jumps from the glass, but once you look past that, you get to toasted apple slices, orange peel and Honeycomb cereal tones beneath, with hints of dried fynbos, sage and lemon wax at the back. The mouthfeel is fleshy, almost generous, with solid wood-grilled apple and orange oil flavors that carry through to the close. Ample acidity and a pleasant texture kicks in to enliven the feel, with lovely spiced orange tea and dried fynbos tones lingering on the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Raats Family 2017 Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This has such a pure, direct nose of citrus rind, waxy melon, fresh honeycomb, white peach, herbal tea and a touch of Anjou pear. The palate is like a laser of precision, delivering a seam of acidity and the sharp tang of just-ripe citrus and orchard fruit tones. It's superbly pithy on the palate, providing a texture that's impossible to ignore. The finish offers more orange-ginger and rooibos tea tones to complement the fruity mélange, with medium intensity and length.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2017 Fire by Night Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: An intense floral character leads the nose of this fresh and earthy white, with prominent scents of sweet pea, honeysuckle and baby powder atop tones of pink apple, spicy pear and sweet orange. The palate is medium weight, though somewhat plush in feel at first, with a generous texture that's balanced by ample acidity and a spicy cut that keeps it all in check. More notes of sweet fynbos unfold on the enduring close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Craven 2017 Karibib Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Rich, lightly honeyed notes of toasted hazelnut, honeydew and beeswax are coupled with a fresh hay accent on the nose. A pronounced saline character greets the palate upon entry and lingers through to the energetic finish. The palate is slightly slick and viscous in feel, but with bright acidity and that salty verve to keep the experience fresh, with flavors of dried apple slices, orange oil and beeswax.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Reyneke 2016 Natural Wine Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: There's a lovely waxiness to the nose here, with notes of lemon oil, straw, yellow melon and a touch of lemon verbena. It smells like the mountains, with wild fynbos and Alpine herbs atop the fruit tones. The palate is light in weight and well balanced, with a prickly sensation that results in a clean, medium-length finish, though the acid is not markedly pronounced.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Reyneke 2017 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: A beautifully direct and focused note of orange blossom, honeysuckle, fresh pear and white melon opens this wine, while the palate is fresh and focused in bright acidity and lime zest flavors that are tart and mouthwatering.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Cederberg 2017 Chenin Blanc (Cederberg)

Description: There's a punchy element upfront on the nose of this wine, almost like a lemon Sour Patch Kid mixed with white pineapple core and a lick of lemon balm. The palate is slick and slippery in feel, though with a bright impression of acidity to pick it up. There's also brightness in a saline character that remains through the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Raised By Wolves 2015 Driehoek Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: For a wine that has had a lot of work done to it (whole bunch pressed, barrel fermented with wild yeast, time on solids, lees stirring, aged in french barriques), this is a surprisingly delicate and unassuming little number. The nose is dainty with aromas of apples, blossoms and a little spice. The palate shows a lovely balance of texture and mouth watering acidity, juicy fruit and white spice. Drink now.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Astrolabe 2016 Wrekin Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: There's a pronounced oaky tone currently at the fore of this wine's bouquet, coupled with notes of spiced orange peel, honeyed beeswax and a touch of yellow melon. The palate is light on its feet despite the pronounced oak and rich flavors, with medium acidity to counter the spicy tones and attractive citrus, guava and melon flavors. On the back are hints of grilled peach pit and lightly toasted nut skins.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Delaire Graff 2017 Swartland Reserve Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: This opens with a pronounced oak note that mellows with some time to waxy melon rind, orange peel, yellow flower and a touch of gingery spice. The medium-weight palate boasts with some soft spice and rich fruit flavors, though neither is overbearing, with soft acidity and a well-balanced mouthfeel.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Painted Wolf 2017 Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Paarl)

Description: The bouquet of this wine is currently very toasty, like buttery popcorn and wood-grilled apple mixed with mealy melon flesh and orange oil. The palate is bold, yet a touch flat on the middle, with medium acidity that just manages to enliven the experience on the close. There's a pleasant pithiness in the texture and lingering spicy tones that lend interest on the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Bellingham 2017 The Bernard Series Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Coastal Region)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Subtle white-fruit aromas, ripe but mild flavors and a smooth texture combine in this light-bodied yet mouthfilling wine. Chalky, mineral elements come out on the finish to add more complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: T. Berkley Wines 2017 Norgard Farms Chenin Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Soft wood spice, Anjou pear, lemon zest and white peach form the bouquet of this white. The palate is medium in weight, but a touch soft on the midpalate, with just enough vibrancy after the swallow to enliven the finish. The citrus and white melon flavors are fresh and easy.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Diemersfontein 2017 Chenin Blanc (Wellington)

Description: A surprisingly pronounced floral character dominates the bouquet of this wine, expressed in aromas of fresh peony, honeysuckle and sweet pea that mix with notes of juicy peach, pineapple and lychee underneath. The palate is light and easy, with a bright, fresh fruit-salad flavor that ends with a mouthwatering impression.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Reyneke 2018 Vinehugger Organic Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Just-ripe orchard fruit, lemon balm, fynbos and bitter melon dance lightly on the nose. The mouth is round and flat on the midpalate, with low acidity. The finish shows some bitterness that helps to enliven the weight of the finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Black Pearl 2017 Chenin Blanc (Wellington)

Description: A south-facing parcel on shale soil has produced this rich wine packed with tropical-fruit flavors as well as crisper apple and citrus acidity. Aged in wood, the wine has some spice, but it really celebrates great fruit and wonderful acidity. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Loïc Mahe 2015 Les Fougeraies  (Savennières)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Mineral, stone fruit and earth are interwoven within a framework of sizzling acidity in this roundly textured, lightly ripe and impressive white wine. The palate is dry and crisp, with exotic tones of honey and almond.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Aperture 2017 Chenin Blanc (North Coast)

Description: This is the main production from the 27-acre property owned by Loïc Mahé. Tank fermented and aged, it has pure apple flavors, crisp and packed with refreshing acidity. Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine is already beautiful to drink but will be better from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Loïc Mahe 2016 Sables et Schistes  (Savennières)

Description: Tangy lemon peels and rich Asian pear flesh meet with intriguing earthy aromas of hot sand in this bottling from one of California's most challenging and fascinating appellations. There is clean and pure acidity that powers that sip, offering flavors of grapefruit and nectarine against a chalky structure.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chalone Vineyard 2017 Chenin Blanc (Chalone)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Always one of the more distinctive white wines from the region, this vintage starts with aromas of lemon skin, forest herbs and chive. The palate is redolent of yellow grapefruit and rides a tense, tangy structure into the long finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Foxen 2017 Ernesto Wickenden Vineyard Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied wine has substantial fruit flavors accented by baking spices and a touch of butter, all laced with good acidity and wrapped in a mouthfilling texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Passaggio 2017 Heringer Estates Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: A walled vineyard in a cool part of the Thierry Germain estate in Souzay is particularly suited to Chenin Blanc. This wine is characterized by apples, fresh acidity and a taut, nervy texture. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, it is beautifully fashioned, brought together by large barrel fermentation and aging. It will age well, so drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 Clos Romans  (Saumur)

Description: This rich, full wine is ripe with yellow fruits, honey and piercing acidity. Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine strikes a brilliant balance between freshness and great richness. It can be drunk now, but will age at least until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Coulaine 2016 Les Pieds Rôtis Chenin Blanc (Touraine)

Description: This wine, living up to its name, is certainly dry. With tight acidity as well as a yeasty edge, it is young and full of bright white fruits. With the intense crisp texture and the mineral character of this wine, allied to the touch of spice from wood aging, it needs to age. Drink this full, fruity wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2017 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This mostly red Saumur Champigny vineyard, surrounded by 300-year-old stone walls, has a dedicated parcel of chalk soil that gives this fragrant, pineapple-flavored white wine an edge of minerality. It is very fresh, textured and with a salty aftertaste. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 L'Echelier  (Saumur)

Description: This ripe, full, generous wine comes from biodynamically grown grapes. It has a rich texture, with flavors of almonds and pears along with a light touch of spice from wood aging. This beautiful wine is very drinkable now but likely will develop further.                      Roger Voss
Name: Xavier et Agnès Amirault 2016 Les Quarterons Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: Delicious apple flavors dominate this wine. While it is essentially dry, a ripe character softens the acidity and gives it a spice and baked-apple character. The wine is still young, needing further aging to reveal its full potential. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Alexandre Monmousseau 2017 Clos le Vigneau  (Vouvray)

Description: Fermented and aged in wood, this mature, rich wine is delicious. Balanced and full of nutty baked apple and spice. the wine is rich and balanced. Its weight and ripe fruits are totally ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Coulaine 2015  Chinon

Description: This wine is full of crisp apple and pear flavors that are lifted by citrus and more exotic pineapple flavors. The mineral edge will soften over the next few months. Drink from late 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Noblaie 2017 Chante le Vent  (Chinon)

Description: This dry, spicy wine has the typical nutty aromas of Chenin Blanc cut through with intense acidity. Its freshness has calmed into a rich, full wine, tight with minerality as well as sliced apple and citrus flavors. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Charles Joguet 2016 Clos de la Plante Martin  (Chinon)
