Description: This dry wine has a creamy texture, with delicious apple and citrus fruits and lively acidity. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, it is spicy with ginger and a lightly honeyed aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 Insolite  (Saumur)

Description: Wood aging in large barrels, known as foudres, has given this wine a rich, smooth and creamy character. Even after four years, it is still bright and fresh although now the honey and yellow fruits have fully developed. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Hureau 2015 Foudre  (Saumur-Champigny)

Description: This wines comes from 40-year-old vines planted on a sandy granite site. The bouquet opens with notes of peach, white tea, chalk, orange blossom and light ginger spice. The lightweight palate offers bright acidity and zippy citrus and green-fruit flavors of tart green-melon rind and lime pith. It's well balanced and easy to drink, with a clean, medium-length finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Terre Brûlée 2017 Le Blanc Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: This rich, complex wine is full of mango and pineapple flavors as well as crisper citrus acidity. The brightness and the tropical-fruit flavors complement each other well, giving a wine that is fresh and ripe at the same time. Drink from late 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Noiré 2017 Noiré Blanc  (Chinon)

Description: Clean apple, Anjou pear and some soft ginger spice unfold on the nose of this bright and well-made wine. The medium-weight palate shows a smooth, lightly slick texture, with nice spice flavors atop ripe fruit tones of pineapple, melon and mango, more tropical in feel than the nose puts forth. Ample acidity lifts the weight and keeps the finish fresh. Drink now–2020.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Spier 2017 Vintage Selection Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: This wood-aged wine is intense with spice and ripe tropical fruit and honey flavors. It is rich, dense, very fruity and also driven by a strong mineral texture. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Frédéric Mabileau 2015 Chenin du Puy  (Saumur)

Description: This offers classic Chenin aromas of citrus rind, green pear and a touch of white melon rind. The lightweight palate boasts bright acidity to cut through the ripe fruit and drive into the mouthwatering finish. It's easy to drink and enjoy, best now–2020.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Beaumont 2017 Chenin Blanc (Bot River)

Description: A chalk soil vineyard offers the opportunity to make this rich and fruity wine. Pineapple and melon mingle easily with citrus flavors to give a wine that is superripe although tempered with acidity and a fresh aftertaste. Drink from late 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Couly-Dutheil 2017 Les Chanteaux  (Chinon)

Description: Crisp fruit from vines planted on gravel soil gives this bright wine, fragrant and packed with citrus acidity. The wine is bone dry, fresh and youthfully fruity. Another few months in bottle will broaden it out. Drink from late 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Frédéric Mabileau 2017 Chenin des Rouillères Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: This wine is all about clean, fresh and bright fruit. Acidity, flavors of citrus and melon, and a bright line of crispness give it an attractive, refreshing character. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2017 Spring  (Vouvray)

Description: Aged in clay amphora, this wine comes from organically grown grapes. It has a soft, velvet texture with fruitiness that is already mature and shows a touch of oxidation. The wine, in its amphora-shaped bottle, is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Noiré 2017 Amphora  (Chinon)

Description: Lanolin, lemon oil, bitter melon rind and a soft petrol character form the nose of this white wine. It somehow smells rich and generous, but not in a fruity way, with the fruit playing only a supporting role here to the richer waxy and oily sensations. The palate is light-plus in weight, but surprisingly nervy and brisk, with searing acidity and green fruit tones that are tart and sharp.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Painted Wolf 2017 The Den Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: There's a pronounced, upfront floral note on the nose of this wine, expressed in scents of carnation and baby's breath. Those are partnered with additional aromas of white peach, underripe guava, yellow melon and a touch of talc. It's light in weight, with bright acidity and a nervy energy that lead into a refreshing, mouthwatering finish. Also available in cans, for on-the-go and easy outdoor enjoyment.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Lubanzi 2018 Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: Touches of fresh grass, herbs and lime leaf mingle with green plum, gooseberry and a touch of green apple on the nose of this bright wine. It's initially zippy, but the midpalate is a little flat, with a weighty, round impression that begs for more lift through the close. The flavors and finish are all bitter walnut, lime peel and melon rind.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Dornier 2017 Bush Vine Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Appellation: Paso Robles Highlands District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean and mellow aromas of green-pear rind, Pink Lady apple flesh and a hint of grapefruit peel show on the nose of this bottling from an own-rooted vineyard planted in 1972. It's tightly woven on the palate, where lime-spray, baked-apple and crushed chalk flavors show.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2017 Shell Creek Vineyards Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles Highlands District)

Description: This late-harvest small production wine is poised between orange-peel flavors and a rich honey. Tense acidity against a smooth, unctuous texture is a perfect balance. Drink this fine wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Colinas do Douro 2015 Colheita Tardiva Chenin Blanc (Douro)

Description: This light, fruity, dry wine smells like apple skins and tastes like crisp Pippin apples. It has good balance, a tangy palate and clean finish. It's easy to imagine pairing it with smoked trout or goat cheese in a first course.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ironstone 2016 Chenin Blanc (California)

Description: This wine is fermented with indigenous yeast and smells like Dole pineapple juice from a can—metallic tang and all. The palate follows suit, with a hint of creamy vanilla adding a bit more complexity.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Monkshood 2017 Hoodoo Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Outer Coastal Plain, New Jersey, US
Description: Extremely pale in this glass, this has an unusual nose comprised of dried flowers, grass clippings and mulch. With a watery mouthfeel, it is sweet upfront in flavors of ripe lemon and lychee, while the finish is clipped leaving a sudden dryness in the mouth.                      Fiona Adams
Name: William Heritage 2016 Estate Grown Chenin Blanc (Outer Coastal Plain)

Description: Fresh fynbos, Asian pear, ginger root, green melon and fig tones form the nose of this lovely wine, with pretty honeysuckle, orange blossom and beeswax accents all dancing in the background. The medium-weight palate boasts some opulence and roundness in the ripe, sweet citrus, melon and fig tones, but it's masterfully balanced by superbly bright and laser-focused acidity. Balanced and harmonious, with a long finish, this is delicious now, but shows some serious long-term potential. Drink now–2028.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Beaumont 2017 Hope Marguerite Chenin Blanc (Bot River)

Description: Woody, rich and concentrated, the nose of this wine shows some serious decadence in the yellow apple, baked pear, yellow melon flesh, honeycomb and spiced orange aromas. The medium-weight palate boasts a nice balance, with ample acidity to cut through the ripe, spicy fruit tones and a lingering pithy impression for textural interest through the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Bellingham 2017 The Old Orchards Chenin Blanc (Paarl)

Description: Faint aromas of fresh honeycomb and beeswax set the stage of this wine's bouquet, with notes of lightly grilled red apple, straw, dried orange rind and a touch of whole sweet spice following suit. The medium-weight palate boasts a ripe fruit core that's lifted by vibrant acidity and a zippy texture that leaves you ready for more on the finish. It's well-balanced and easy to like, with a pleasant textural spice on the evolving close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Bellingham 2016 The Old Orchards Chenin Blanc (Paarl)

Description: Lightly baked apple, spiced pear, yellow melon and fig all dance on the nose of this lovely bottling, presided over by a lovely fresh honeycomb aroma and subtle ginger and yellow flower accents. It's a harmonious and tasty pour, medium in weight and with a mouthwatering citrus-driven finish that then veers into spicy accents.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Graham Beck 2015 The Game Reserve Chenin Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: The bouquet of this interesting, supertextural wine leads with notes of white peach and peach pit, yellow melon and grilled apple. Supporting tones of ginger root, fresh hay and savory fresh herbs add depth from the background. Ripe yet pithy melon and orange flavors carry through to the close and lend a lasting textural impression to the palate. Ample acidity supports the package, just picking up the density of the flavors and textural weight. A lightly toasty, nutty almond and melon flavor resides on the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Boschkloof 2016 Patatsfontein Enkel Wingerd Steen Chenin Blanc (Montagu)

Description: Scents of honeycomb, beeswax and yellow melon abound on the nose of this wine, with some light sweet spice, baked apple and yellow flower accents. It's medium in weight, with ample acidity to lift the ripe orange, apple and pineapple core flavors and a slight prickle to the palate.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Lievland 2017 Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Paarl)

Description: This wine offers a bouquet of honeydew melon and guava. It is soft on the palate, with flavors of toasted pineapple and lemon with a clean almond finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Sula 2017 Estate Bottled Chenin Blanc (Nashik)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Stolpman team is pushing the usual boundaries on many fronts, which makes this bottling, a partnership with superstar somm Rajat Parr, both compelling and challenging. The nose combines smoked almonds with preserved lemon aromas, while the acid-loaded palate is tangy yet nutty all at once.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Combe 2017 Chenin Blanc (Ballard Canyon)

Description: This wine is a long-running success story for the winery. It carries aromas of citrus zest and freshly sliced apples on the nose. The palate shows good balance through crisp acidity and a medium body, tempered slightly by 4 g/L residual sugar.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Dry Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: Organically grown grapes from a single parcel go into this resplendent wine. Touched lightly by wood but much more focused on honey and apple, spice and intense acidity, the wine is ripe, peppery and set to age. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2016 Le Clos  (Vouvray)

Description: Neither dry nor sweet, this wine is fruity, with a firm edge of minerality and a zesty character. It hovers between acidity, fresh fruit and a more honeyed character giving poise and some good aging potential. Drink this succulent wine from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Gaverie 2017 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Aged for a short period in wood, this well-made wine has gained an extra richness while remaining almost bone dry. Honey, acidity and spiced-apple flavors combine easily. Drink now or wait until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Gaverie 2017 Sec  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of honeycomb, apple and the underside of a pineapple. It drinks dry, with a textured feel to the pineapple flavors. Yum.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cedergreen Cellars 2016 Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This full, dry Chenin conveys notes of flowers, zesty citrus and crunchy ripe apple. Its acidity is bright and crisp while keeping richness and an open texture up front. Drink this wine now, or wait until 2020 for a more mature character.                      Roger Voss
Name: Famille Duveau 2017  Saumur

Description: This ripe, medium-sweet wine is crisp as well as full of honey accents. Almonds, spice and delicious baked-apple flavors are well integrated into this stylish wine. Drink now or, better, from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Cuvée V Vieilles Vignes Grande Réserve
Name: Bougrier 2017 Cuvée V Vieilles Vignes Grande Réserve  (Vouvray)

Description: Almonds, spice and great fruitiness all contribute to the success of this wine. Acidity keeps it bright while a honeyed edge entices. It is refreshingly ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Paul Buisse 2017 Clos du Gaimont Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Even in this dry Chenin, a hint of honey accompanies the apple fruitiness. A ripe wine, it also has plenty of acidity and attractive layers of fruitiness and almonds, with a crisp texture at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pierre Chainier 2017 Clos Chapon Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Lightly honeyed and with white fruits, almonds and a touch of minerality, this wine is already delicious. Its freshness and crisp texture are both young and the wine will age. Drink at its best from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moncontour 2017 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This honey- and apple-flavored wine is deliciously fresh. With a hint of almonds as well as the fruit, it is perfumed and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Pinsonnière NV Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: This young wine is light, bright and packed with crisp green fruits, citrus and a touch of honey. It is zesty with freshness and good acidity at the end. Drink from 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Petit Coteau 2017 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: From vineyards above the grand chateau of Moncontour close to the Loire, this medium-dry wine offers acidity and crisp white fruits. Its freshness is as important as the perfumed fruitiness, giving the wine the potential to age. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moncontour 2017 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This wine is yeasty and fruity, with good aging potential. Nuttiness, spice and a touch of ginger give this wine a fruity character that is still developing. Good acidity and a crisp floral aftertaste point to the future. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2016 Tania & Vincent Carême Spring  (Vouvray)

Description: As crisp as possible with delicious apple flavors and a bubbly mousse, this wine is dry while also having a light honey character. It is perfumed, fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Tania & Vincent Carême Cuvée T Brut
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême NV Tania & Vincent Carême Cuvée T Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: Spicy and with a good mineral streak, this wine also has a creamy character from the mousse and exotic hints of vanilla and hazelnut. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Monmousseau NV Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: This wine has a pronounced yeasty, autolytic character that rides atop scents of dried apple skin, grilled challah, pie crust and orange peel. A lively mousse and mouthwatering acidity helps to keep the palate in check, lifting the rich and toasty flavors through the finish. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Ken Forrester 2014 Sparklehorse Méthode Cap Classique Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This is an odd style of wine, neither dry nor sweet. It offers hints of honey as well as orange-zest flavors that are currently confused with acidity, tight apple tastes and acidity. Things should coalesce in time leaving a fresh and honeyed wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pierre Chainier 2017 Clos Chapon Demi Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This soft, medium-sweet Chenin Blanc offers crisp acidity, creamed apple and honey flavors and a clean aftertaste. Drink this light, perfumed wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Marquis de Goulaine 2017 La Loire Royale  (Vouvray)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Restrained aromas of citrus, apple peel and limestone carry to the immensely zesty palate. Electric acidity carries from start to finish, ending on a sour lime note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paumanok 2017 Dry Chenin Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This is pleasant and easy-drinking, with notes of fresh-cut apple, orange pith, lemon rind and a touch of talc. It's light in weight, with brisk acidity, high carbonation and tart lime, green apple and plum notes that are short but refreshing.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: MAN Family Wines NV Brut Chenin Blanc (South Africa)

Description: Although labeled Moelleux this wine is rather half-hearted about being sweet. It is delicious with acidity and baked-apple flavors, but misses out on intensity. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Paul Buisse 2015 Clos du Gaimont Moelleux  (Vouvray)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This spontaneous ferment Chenin offers aromas of sauced apples and pears on the nose. Light in feel, the palate is straightforward in nature, displaying spiced tree fruit flavors carried along by a healthy vein of acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paumanok 2016 Minimalist Chenin Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Crisp and clean, this is a ripe, honeyed wine. With citrus to balance the honey and a touch of minerality, it is attractive and balanced. Packed with acidity at the end, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bougrier 2017 Cuvée V Douce France  (Vouvray)

Description: This innocuous, medium-sweet wine offers almond and baked-apple flavors. It is light, fruity, crisp and clean, ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bougrier 2017 Alain de la Treille  (Vouvray)

Description: Beautifully floral in jasmine and apple blossom, this is a dry, mineral-laden expression of the variety that shines in wet stone, peach and lemon, while delivering sticky, refreshing acidity. Well integrated and light in approach, it will work beautifully on the table as a white with body and elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2017 Signature Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied wine offers depth and complexity that are unusual for the varietal in California. It has lightly earthy, mineral, figgy aromas, a palate-coating texture and layers of flavor that unfold from apple to almond to fig, giving it the substance to be a main-course wine, not just a pre-dinner beverage.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lang & Reed 2017 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are generous, with notes of dried pineapple, mango and apricot. The stone-fruit and tropical-fruit flavors are rich, sweet and focused, showing a lovely sense of balance that carries through the finish. Bright acidity provides the frame.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kiona 2017 Estate Grown Ice Wine Chenin Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: Earthy and oaky, this white is floral and lengthy, with a moderate body of ripeness and weight. Peach, apple and lime play on the midpalate before finishing in a burst of white flowers.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lang & Reed 2017 Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Apple skin and pine-needle aromas waft up from this light-bodied wine, while crisp apple and mild floral accents dominate the fresh and quite fruity flavors. It's helpful that the label reveals a 11 g/L residual sugar, which means it is a touch sweet.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2017 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: Dry and medium bodied, this wine has appley aromas, apple-skin flavors and a tangy, edgy texture. It tastes rather low on the ripeness scale but has refreshing qualities.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vinum Cellars 2016 Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Old-vine Chenin Blanc is becoming increasingly rare in the state as vines are pulled out to replant more profitable varieties. What a shame. The aromas here offer notes of freshly sliced pear, cantaloupe, banana, melon rind and papaya. The bone-dry palate brings an abundant tropical-fruit flavor and a strong sense of acidity. It lingers on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2017 Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is richness as well as briskness on the nose of this bottling, starting with tightly wound aromas of orange cream, citrus rind and cantaloupe. The palate offers chilled apple and tangy lemon-rind flavors, but it's the chalky texture that is most compelling.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zanoli 2017 Jurassic Park Vineyard Block CW-X1 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of this wine are quite light initially, seeming hard to tease out before opening to reveal notes of green apple, citrus zest, toasted Grape-Nuts and minerals. It drinks bone dry, while bringing a sense of richness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Orr 2017 Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas fascinate with notes of dried yellow apple, pear and apple peel. The palate is bone dry, made in a sleek, elegant style, with a bright sense of acidity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Fielding Hills 2017 Rothrock Vineyard Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Interesting aromas of dried pear, mango, honeydew rind and cherimoya show on the nose of this bottling. There is tightness and freshness to the sip, but the acidity fades quickly as flavors of lemon peel and dried apple arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sevtap 2016 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Coteaux du Layon, Loire Valley, France
Description: The gold color immediately sets this botrytis-laden wine apart. It is a brilliantly rich wine, aged for a few months in barrel to give it even greater intensity. It's full of honey and apricot flavors and packed with intense acidity. It is tough not to drink it now, but it will age for a long time, and be best opened after 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2015 Cuvée Maxence Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

Description: Winemaker: Bruwer Raats. Fresh apple flesh, white peach, melon and creamed citrus form the fruity core of this attractive white, all hit with spicy top-notes of lightly toasted oak and woodspice. Medium in weight, the palate shows a roundness and creamy texture that complements the rich, ripe fruit flavors, but is lifted by vibrant acidity that keeps the mouthfeel fresh and the finish crisp. It's easy to like now, but this should continue to develop further depth and complexities well through 2028.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Designation: Cape Winemakers Guild Fountain Block Terroir Specific
Name: Raats Family 2017 Cape Winemakers Guild Fountain Block Terroir Specific Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This single-vineyard wine is impressively ripe and rich. It is maturing although nowhere near its peak. The ripe apple, mango and kiwi fruits are matched by the intensity of the mineral texture. Let it age further and drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Laffourcade 2015 Clos de Quarts Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: Superripe grapes are the secret behind this rich wine. Although it is dry, this floral wine offers a touch of honey that balances the crisp apple flavors and opulent texture. Still young, this intense wine deserves to age. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2017 Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: Made in a dry style but with a honeyed edge, this is a balanced and crisp wine. Youthful acidity combines with flavors of almonds, quince and spice to give a wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Alexandre Monmousseau 2016 Clos le Vigneau  (Vouvray)

Description: Winemaker: Pierre Wahl. This is rich and concentrated in yellow apple, melon and creamed pear tones upfront, with supporting notes of orange pith, pressed honeysuckle and lightly toasted nuts for added depth and some textural interest. The medium-weight palate offers a roundish mouthfeel, countered by ample acidity and a textural grip of apple skin and citrus peel flavor.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Rijk's 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild CWG Chenin Blanc (Tulbagh)

Description: This rich, dry wine is opulent, with an intense spice and mineral texture. It offers ripe quince and green-plum flavors cut with tight acidity. Still a young wine, it needs time. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Laffourcade 2016  Savennières

Description: A soft wine, medium dry in character, this brings out the attractive almond and spice character of the Chenin Blanc. It offers quince and pear flavors, with acidity and a ripe green-apple aftertaste. Drink this fruity wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Michel Picard 2016 Le Petit Perroy  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Coming from old vines, this bottling is typically one of the more compelling non-Chardonnays from Santa Barbara County. This vintage shows light lemon, chalk, white peach and Asian pear on the nose. The palate is grippy as ever, with lemon-lime acidity and a green-pear flavor.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Foxen 2016 Ernesto Wickenden Vineyard Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a tight, lean and refreshing wine with minimal ripeness but great acidity and a very clean palate-cleansing texture. It's just the thing for acid freaks and will light up pairings like goat cheese and seafood.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Graziano 2016 Dry Chenin Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very floral and pungent aromas of melon, poached apple and canned pear make for an intriguing entry into this bottling. There is tremendous zest to the sip, with high-toned citrus flavors lifting the apple flavors. It's very tasty and zippy.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2017 Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight aromas of guava, nectarine and bubblegum show on the nose of this bottling by young winemaker Natalie Darr. The supple yet racy palate is framed by intensely bright acidity and a solid grip, delivering flavors of white cherry, fresh Pink Lady apple and rounded melon.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rococo 2017 Chenin Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Old-vine Chenin Blanc is rapidly slipping away in Washington as growers rip out vines for more profitable varieties. It's a shame as it can excel here, as this wine shows. Coming in at an almost unheard of alcohol level for the state, aromas of poached pear, apple, lees, citrus and spice are followed by bone-dry, sleek, tart flavors with a lemony finish. The acids are downright racy. It needs some food alongside it to be properly appreciated but it delivers.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Old Vine Gnarl Block Rothrock Vineyard
Name: Block Wines 2016 Old Vine Gnarl Block Rothrock Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From 40-year-old vines comes this semisweet wine by young winemaker Natalie Darr, full of aromas of honey, honeysuckle, chamomile and fortune cookies on the nose. The sweetness is subtle on the palate, as it surrounds a chalky core and grippy texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rococo 2016 Chenin Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From 40-year-old vines in Los Alamos comes this crisp, lovely wine, which shows nectarine, Meyer lemon spray and grapefruit peel aromas on the nose. The palate is crisp and grippy, with light stone-fruit flavors alongside crushed white rocks and a slight citrus tang.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rococo 2016 Sur Lie Chenin Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine underwent a vineyard change this vintage; the fruit now comes from 1979 plantings at Upland. The aromas pop, recalling scooped cantaloupe, ripe pear, red apple and freshly sliced star fruit, with intriguing salinity. Simultaneously sleek and textured fruit flavors lead to an acid-driven finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: W.T. Vintners 2017 Upland Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: While more at home in the Loire, Cahors growers have found that Chenin Blanc is able to express the local terroir. This perfumed wine is fruity, creamy and textured, with a strong minerality. It is still young and fruity, and will likely age further. Drink now or wait until 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2015 de Mercuès Sec Chenin Blanc (Côtes du Lot)

Description: This is a beautiful, ripe, honeyed wine. Produced from organically grown grapes, it has richness as well as a touch of spice from partial oak aging. The wine will age further to give a sumptuous richness from 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vigneau-Chevreau 2016 Cuvée Silex  (Vouvray)

Description: This is 100% varietal and entirely from grapes grown in the Oak Knoll District, a cooler section of the valley. Aged minimally in both French oak and stainless steel the wine is noteworthy for its crispness and fleshy texture. Peach and apricot figure prominently alongside honey oak and a tease of salty brine. This is one of Napa's classic whites for good reason.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lang & Reed 2016 Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: With three years bottle aging, this wine has begun to develop attractive, mature toasty flavors that add richness to floral, crisp character of the fruit. The wine is both rich and soft, generous and very ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2014 De Chanceny Excellence Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: Nutty and fruity at the same time, this pear-flavored wine with its hint of honey is dry while also soft. It offers intriguing balance between roundness and dryness, a refreshing style that will make a fine aperitif.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vigneau-Chevreau NV Pétillant Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: This light-bodied wine has a steely crisp-green-apple quality and an array of flavors that are more savory than fruity. Hints of vanilla and wet stone in the aroma are followed by a tangy, rather lean palate impression. It should be brilliant for food pairing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: La Pitchoune 2016 la bombe Merritt Island Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: This wine is soft, honeyed, ripe with baked apple and gentle acidity. It is off dry, heading towards sweet, while never forgetting a crisp edge that gives a citrus finish. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vigneau-Chevreau NV Pétillant Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: After three years aging in bottle, this ripe, delicious wine is packed with white fruits and with a creamy texture that gives richness and freshness at the same time. It is lightly spicy, crisply textured to finish and ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble Brisebarre 2012 Cuvée Millésimée Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: While the wine is certainly Sec (dry), it is also attractively rich with honey, yellow fruits and good balance between acidity and ripeness. Soft and full of fruit, it offers a nutty aftertaste.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble Brisebarre 2015 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Ripe apricots and pineapple are laced together with a smooth texture, lightly cut with attractive acidity. This perfumed wine is poised and lightly herbal. The tangy texture gives a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Cave de Saumur 2015 Domaine de Montbrillais  (Saumur)

Description: Aged two years before release, this pure Chenin Blanc wine is crisp while having the nutty, lightly honeyed character typical of the grape. Apples and spice join the yeasty flavor in this bone-dry, crisp wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignoble Brisebarre NV Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: Named after a parcel of land that has belonged to the village since the Middle Ages, this wine is off dry. Its tangy, lemon and honey character is filled out with peach and almond-paste flavors. The wine is young, needing a few more months to round out. Drink from late 2018.                      Roger Voss
Name: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2015 Les Dîmes  (Vouvray)

Description: Lightly off-dry, this wine is gently fruity with quince and pear flavors. A hint of honey and almonds brings out the soft texture. The wine has a crisp, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Valmier 2016  Vouvray

Description: This off-dry wine comes from vines growing on the plateau above Vouvray. A ripe wine, it's full of yellow fruits with a honeyed edge. Floral and lifted by crisp lemon acidity, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2015 La Javeline  (Vouvray)

Description: This is a soft, off-dry wine. White and yellow fruits are perfumed and crisp with acidity. Hints of almonds and toast go with the gentle texture. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2016 Les Chancelières  (Vouvray)

Description: This wine is currently a baby, wanting more time to completely form and express itself with full potential. The nose is shy at first, needing some airing to coax out notes of singed fynbos, greengage and white melon rind. The palate offers a bit more fruit expression, as waves of citrus peel, Asian pear and dried apple skin are framed by a chalky minerality and just a hint of nutty stone-fruit pit. A sea-breeze salinity graces the driven, precise finish. Drink 2020–2028.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2015 Magnetic North Mountain Makstok Chenin Blanc (Olifants River)

Description: Pristine aromas of white melon, green plum, apple blossom and lemon leaf open the nose of this gorgeous white, with touches of fresh fynbos and almond skin for added depth. The palate offers a pithy, lightly astringent texture that supports the soft fruit flavors. This is more about structure, balance and feel than overt fruit tones, with the overall harmony and complexity to continue to evolve well through 2030.    The palate is very well balanced with fine acidity, more a textural delight than overt flavors with sublime orange pith, walnut and saline notes on the ethereal finish.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2015 Radio Lazarus Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: A stunning wine, this opens with scents of golden straw, honeydew rind, firm nectarine and fresh honeycomb that all carry through to the medium-weight mouth. The palate boasts a flinty, mineral texture and bright acidity that lends verve and precision to the notes of toasted apple, spiced orange rind and pressed yellow flowers. Hints of fresh herbs and minty fynbos grace the enduring finish. It sure is delicious now, but try this stunner from 2020–2028.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Mullineux 2015 Granite Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: The Quartz is a bit flashier than Mullineux's other soil-specific bottlings, with pronounced notes of roasted apple skin, orange oil, pressed yellow flowers, juicy pear and even a hint of fresh guava. The palate is full and opulent, though deftly balanced by vibrant acidity and a lingering flavor of spiced-pear tart. Drink now–2026.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Mullineux 2015 Quartz Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: This is in its infancy now, but it's remarkably refined and nuanced, showing great promise for evolution and development. Notes of melon rind, orange peel, lemon verbena and fresh fynbos fill the bouquet, while the palate offers more pithy citrus and green melon characters. It's well-balanced, with vibrant acidity and a fresh wet-stone minerality that endures through the long finish. It's hard to resist now, but it will continue to mature and hold well through 2024.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: L'Avenir 2015 Single Block 30 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: A little reserved at first, with time this opens up to reveal notes of pressed fynbos, dandelion, fresh straw, apple blossom and crushed mineral that grace the just-ripe apple and green-melon core. Surprisingly round and mouth-filling, that weight is countered by a stunningly vibrant seam of citrusy acidity and spiced tones of allspice and nutmeg. Final notes of grilled apple skin and pie crust dance on the lingering finish. Drink now–2026.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: The Blacksmith 2015 Vin Blanc Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: This is tight and reserved at first, needing time to open and reveal notes of green apple, lemon-lime citrus, yellow plum and underripe mango. Given those tight, bright aromas, it's surprising to encounter the medium-weight, round mouthfeel, with low acidity and ripe tones of guava and white grapefruit that carry through to the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Ken Forrester 2015 Dirty Little Secret One Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: This is a well-balanced and attractive pour, with scents of orange blossom, lemon verbena, quinine and lime that frame the just-ripe peach and melon fruit core. A pithy astringency provides a subtle texture to the palate and lends some lingering grip to the finish, coupled with a vibrant acidity that leaves you read for more. Drink now–2022.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Quinta Essentia 2015 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This showcases a nice balance between ripe-fruit notes, toasty warmth and ample acidity. Aromas of lemon custard, creamed pear and baked apple set the stage, framed by scents of toasted walnuts and clover honey. The palate offers a bit more restraint and verve, with notes of orange and lime peel that refresh the sip. Drink now–2023.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Ken Forrester 2015 The FMC Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Quite pronounced in tropical fruit and floral aromas, this opens with attractive scents of pressed buttercup, honeysuckle and lime lead that frame the guava, pineapple rind and red apple fruit core. Those ripe-fruit tones carry through to the medium-weight palate, with bright, orange-laced acidity to lift. A final note of delicate sweet spice on the way back of the close. Drink now–2022.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Spier 2015 Vintage Collection Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Description: Delicate scents of white melon, orange rind, pressed wild flowers, quinine and barely-toasted apple skin dance in the bouquet of this attractive wine. Clean, precise flavors of apple flesh, Anjou pear and lime unfold on the medium-weight palate, while vibrant acidity enlivens the mouthfeel and results in a bright, mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2023.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Keermont 2015 Riverside Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Scents of honeysuckle, beeswax, baked apple and whole spice lead the nose of this attractive white. The palate showcases a goregeous balance between ripe fruit tones, well-integrated spice and ample acidity, with a gravely texture that lends length to the close. Final notes of woodspice and citrus pith leave you ready for more. Drink now–2024.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Radford Dale 2015 The Renaissance of Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Lovely, bright notes of green citrus, pear, greengage and fig set the stage for this crisp, refreshing white, with secondary hints of fresh straw, lanolin and strawberry hull add additional layers of interest. The palate boasts a fresh, chalky mineral texture, with a final hint of just-toasted almond on the evolving close. Drink now–2023.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Quinta Essentia 2016 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Lightly toasted apple, melon and guava form the core of this ripe and fruit-forward wine. It's light in body and style, with clean yet delicate acidity and a brisk close. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Bradgate 2015 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Fresh apple, orange and green melon are at the fore of this straightforward yet refreshing and tasty wine. It is light in weight and concentration, offering fruity flavors of apple and pear that finish bright and clean. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Deetlefs 2015 Chenin Blanc (Breedekloof)

Description: Medium straw in color, this wine features aromas of apple and honeysuckle. It is tart at first sip, with flavors of lemon-lime and Gala apple that are slowly overtaken by strong notes of eucalyptus. Fruit flavors return on the finish, offering a closing note of pear.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Dalton 2016 Estate Oak Aged Chenin Blanc (Galilee)

Description: Soft scents of white flowers, pear and peach subtly make themselves known on the nose of this direct wine. It's lightweight and approachable, with ripe-fruit and sweet-orange flavors that flesh out the palate. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Tierhoek 2015 Chenin Blanc (Piekenierskloof)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded, plush and extremely tropical aromas of white peach, cantaloupe and poached pear show on the nose of this bottling. The sip tightens up a bit, then shows coconut oil, tuberose and more poached pear. Cleanly made, but quite ripe.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pear Valley 2016 Pear Valley Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from the oldest Chenin plantings in the state, the aromas are light, with notes of sliced apple, flower and white peach. It drinks off dry, with sleek well-balanced honeyed-fruit flavors throughout. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pacific Rim 2016 Old Vines Hahn Hill Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling dials in strongly to a crushed chalk aroma, which is peppered over the lemon pith and rainy sidewalk scents. It's very fresh and tightly wound on the palate, with lime spray, beeswax, a touch of petrol and a slight botanical element.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Barton 2015 Landslide Jurassic Park Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light on the nose, this bottling from 37-year-old vines shows squeezed lemon wedge, chilled Asian pear, hints of jicama and white rose petals on the nose. The citrusy palate is driven by a grapefruit pith flavor and enhanced with a touch of chalk. The texture is compellingly grippy.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Birichino 2015 Old Vines Jurassic Park Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas are bright and focused, with honeycrisp apple, passion fruit and pear notes. The apple and stone fruit flavors are off dry, showing no obvious oak influence.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: 14 Hands 2016 Reserve Chenin Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: L'Ecole has been carrying the banner for Washington Chenin high since 1987. Coming from vineyards planted in 1978 and 1979, the aromas are fresh and lively, with notes of sliced pear, passion fruit, flower and apple. The palate is full in feel and redolent with fruit flavors that sail on the finish. It's a one-wine charm offensive.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2016 Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A grassy grapefruity aroma and fresh citrus flavors make this medium-bodied wine refreshing, while a touch of sweetness on the palate and finish takes off the edge of acidity. It's light to medium bodied.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2016 Prince Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Coteaux du Layon, Loire Valley, France
Description: At 35-years-old, this golden wine may be old, but it is still glorious. Still honeyed, with hints of its past yellow and bitter-orange fruit still there, the wine is intense, with toast, almonds and a richness that is so concentrated. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moulin Touchais 1982 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

Appellation: Coteaux du Layon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This estate, owned by the same family since 1787, has amazing stocks of old sweet wines maturing in its cellars. With red apple, honey and apricot aromas, this wine, mature and yet so fresh, is proof of the aging ability of Chenin Blanc. It is the balance between the ripe honeyed flavors and the intense acidity that keeps it so vibrant. Drink this superb wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moulin Touchais 1996 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

Description: From an organic parcel of vines, this floral and honey-flavored wine is superbly rich. The 12 months in wood adds spice and a touch of toast as well as giving the wine a delicious oxidative edge. It is an opulent wine, hinting at honey, with ripe melon and quince flavors. Drink this impressive wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2015 Le Clos  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Coteaux du Layon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This amazing wine, gold in color, is one of the treasures that appear from time to time from the underground cellars of this great producer. It is old, but its sweetness has not been impaired by age. Rather the sweetness has become intense richness and intense acidity. The wine, full and opulent, is, of course, ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moulin Touchais 1985 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

Description: From one of the top of the new generation of Vouvray estates, this wine is a delicious medley of fruit flavors. With a touch of honey to go with the apple, and citrus to give extra freshness, this is a beautiful wine. It is very drinkable although still so young. Drink now if you can't wait, but it's better to hold on until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2015 Le Peu Morier  (Vouvray)

Description: Owner Molly Chappellet's beloved baby, this white is deliciously crisp, dry and balanced, with layers of Meyer lemon, waxy apple and floral gardenia. Percolating acidity maintains its freshness beneath its rich texture and tropical succulence.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2016 Signature Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: White peach aromas and powerful fruitiness give this wine great intensity. It is bone dry while rich, full of quince, pear and peach fruits. There is an extra richness from the edge of wood aging. The wine is still young and should not be drunk before 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2015 Sec  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Danish sommelier-turned-winemaker Leo Hansen aims to make food-friendly wines, and this delicate Chenin is a great example. Light honey, candied lemon, lime pith and tangerine peel aromas show subtly on the nose. Sparkly acidity makes its clean and crisp nectarine, cherimoya and lime skin flavors pop, with pinpoint focus and a slight grip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Leo Steen Wines 2014 The Steen Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: While this wine is certainly sweet with yellow fruits and plenty of ripe honey flavors, it also has a beautiful streak of acidity that allows the wine to be crisply textured. There are spice, great fruitiness and a bright tight aftertaste. Drink now, or better from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs 2016 Le Bouchet Moelleux  (Vouvray)

Description: Naturally sparkling rather than needing any addition of yeast or sugar, this fine bone-dry wine has great style, great character. Its honey, apple and slight oxidative flavor are all part of a wine that is impressively ripe and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2014 Ancestrale Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: Aged in wood and certainly dry, this creamed apple wine is ripe, hinting at toast from wood aging and with a fine mineral texture. Finely balanced, it is rich while still poised, cut with acidity and lime-juice flavor. Drink now for the fruitiness or wait until 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs 2016 Le Bouchet Sec  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Coteaux du Layon, Loire Valley, France
Description: Nutty mature aromas hint at the ripe, certainly mature flavors in the glass. This amazing wine is still intensely rich, still hinting at its past glories of honeyed fruits. But now it is settling comfortably into old age—a wine that is almost dry while still rich. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moulin Touchais 1991 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

Description: The beautiful apple aromas lead to a delicious wine. It has honey, creamed apple and spice flavors, cut through with acidity as well as almonds. The wine is ripe, balancing its crisp texture with richer fruits. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moncontour 2015 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Coteaux du Layon, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a liquorous wine, still with its youthful yellow-fruit and honey flavors that are cut with the dry botrytis core. The wine is rich and with a fine balance between the opulence and acidity. This is a wine to savor now, although it will also age further, certainly until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moulin Touchais 2005 Chenin Blanc (Coteaux du Layon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely light, clean and pure aromas of tart grapefruit rind and citrus blossoms show on the nose of this bottling from the Jurassic Park Vineyard. There's bountiful energy to the palate, where the citrusy freshness of lemon rinds meets brisk, sea breeze-like salinity and the lightest hint of melon and Pink Lady apple. Serve with shellfish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Roark Wine Co. 2015 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pale in the glass, this wine from the Jurassic Park Vineyard booms with clean and crisp tropical notes on the nose, showing poached pear, papaya, pineapple and gardenia aromas. Energetic acidity delivers its peach, mango and guava flavors, making for a potent but not treacly palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Municipal Winemakers 2016 Blanche Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This outstanding wine is quite lush and ripe without being overtly fruity. It has enticing vanilla and coconut aromas, ripe honeydew melon and fig flavors and an exceptionally viscous and creamy mouthfeel. It's full bodied and very smooth in texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lang & Reed 2016 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: Medium sweet, this wine brings out the fine honeyed character of ripe Chenin Blanc. That is balanced against the crisp golden-plum fruit that gives the wine bright acidity. This is a lightly wood-aged wine and that has helped to round the aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs 2016 Le Bouchet Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: White wine is rare among producers in Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil who normally concentrate on red wines. However, this wood-aged wine from a parcel that is better suited to Chenin Blanc, has a fine texture, crisp apples even a touch of honey. It should age a little longer, so drink from 2018.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Amirault 2015 Les Quarterons Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is extremely light in aroma and flavor (though both will increase with bottle age), so its texture is its strongest selling point. Faint peach skin, nectarine flesh, melon and citrus aromas lead into a perfectly grippy palate, where citrus peel and beeswax flavors crescendo into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Leo Steen Wines 2015 The Steen Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: From old vines, up to 45-years-old, the wine is attractively off dry, retaining plenty of acidity as well as gaining touches of honey and creamed apples. The wine is light while deliciously fruity. Drink from mid 2018.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moncontour 2016 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This nutty aromatic wine is crisp, tight and with intense acidity. It has a mineral edge as well as citrus fruit, grapefruit and lemon flavors. The wine is lively, perfumed and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Amirault 2015 Les Quarterons Brut Chenin Blanc (Crémant de Loire)

Description: The touches of wood aging are apparent in the almond and toasty edge to this perfumed wine. Quince and apricot fruit show strongly through the tight dry texture and minerality. It's a wine made to be drunk young with great fruit. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2015 Spring  (Vouvray)

Description: This is a spicy wine, its fruit merged with toastiness and almond flavors. Fermentation in wood has created a wine that has layers of flavors as well as crisp honeyed fruit and acidity. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs 2014 Cuvée Premium  (Vouvray)

Description: This wine is marked as sec (dry) and it is certainly that. The acidity is intense, cutting through the apple fruits and almond flavors. The wine obviously needs to soften and mature for a few months, so drink from 2018.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moncontour 2016 Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: Although it is dry, this wine with its gentle mousse has a light touch of honey to go with the ripe pear and cantaloupe flavors. It has a crisp edge, lightly toasty, dry and with tight acidity at the end.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vincent Carême 2014 Cuvée T Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: A wine that is moving towards sweet, this is balanced and attractive. Honey and acidity frame the melon and ripe creamed apple fruits. With a touch of spice at the end, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Cuvée V Vieilles Vignes Grande Réserve
Name: Bougrier 2016 Cuvée V Vieilles Vignes Grande Réserve  (Vouvray)

Description: Lightly sweet and very fruity, this wine is an easy-drinking, rather light-bodied choice for a picnic or for anyone with a sweet tooth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Husch 2016 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

Description: This crisp wine with light citrus, toast and spice flavors is open and fruity. Behind the apple and pear flavors there are almonds, pepper and tangy acidity. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Collegiale des Domaines de Loire 2015 Les Bois de Vaux Sec  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From 30-year-old vines, this is one of the finest examples of this variety to come out of the state in recent vintages. It delivers citrus, candlewax, lees, apple and pear aromas, the palate sleekly styled with a blast of acidity that makes it a versatile pour for the dinner table.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lobo Hills 2015 Roth Rock Farm Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The first white wine from Fielding Hills, this boasts fresh yellow apple and herb aromas, which lead to dry-tasting fruit flavors. It's cleanly made, albeit a bit short.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Fielding Hills 2016 Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A buttery aroma and flavors like apples and apple cider are backed by good acidity in this nicely tangy, dry and palate-cleansing wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Graziano 2015 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: This wine comes from a vineyard, created in 1894, in which the vines are planted against walls to get the maximum reflected heat. It is a majestic wine—a smooth wave, opulent and rich with intense acidity and just a hint of spice. The wine is just ready to drink, although it will be even more impressive from 2018.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Parnay 2011 Clos d'Entre les Murs  (Saumur)

Description: The abbey of Marmoutier was founded in the 4th century by Saint Martin. The walled vineyard is owned by the city of Tours, across the Loire from Vouvray. The wine is off dry, ripe with pear and honey and deliciously balanced with the acidity. It is young and will repay aging, so drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Abbaye de Marmoutier Clos du Rougemont
Name: Domaine Vigneau-Chevreau 2015 Abbaye de Marmoutier Clos du Rougemont  (Vouvray)

Description: Produced from organic grapes, the wine is beautiful and honey touched. Its acidity keeps crispness while the fruit shines with lemon and creamed-apple flavors. Drink from 2018.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Vigneau-Chevreau 2015 Cuvée Silex  (Vouvray)

Description: This biodynamic wine is a study in contrasts. Non-fruit aromas of wax, paraffin and lanolin are offset by bright pineapple flavors, while a long, zesty finish balances the wine's ample weight and slightly creamy texture. Delicious now, it should drink well through at least 2022.                      Joe Czerwinski
Name: Millton 2015 Te Arai Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Gisborne)

Description: This is a dry wine, although still retaining those enticing honey flavors that are typical of Loire Chenin Blanc. Apple and ripe pear flavors are laced with intense acidity. Its delicate white-flower perfumes are ethereal. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos du Gaimont 2016  Vouvray

Description: Chenin Blanc isn't common in New Zealand, but the ones made here tend to be worth trying. This plump, medium-bodied wine features intense notes of melon and pear, along with a hint of anise. The finish is long and refreshingly crisp. Drink now.                      Joe Czerwinski
Name: Astrolabe 2014 Wrekin Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Marlborough)

Description: This is a honey and almond-flavored wine. With its light acidity and creamed-apple fruitiness, it is soft with a crisp edge. Drink this attractive sparkling wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Paris-Simoneau NV Brut Prestige Chenin Blanc (Touraine)

Description: The limestone soil gives this juicy fruity wine a fine tight line of minerality. That contrasts with the apricot and lemon flavors that shine out from this generous wine. It is ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Parnay 2014 Chemin des Murs  (Saumur)

Description: The wine comes from vineyards on the plateau above the village of Vouvray. It is a ripe, lemon and honey-flavored wine with balanced acidity that creates a clean, crisp, perfumed and fruity aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Chapon 2016  Vouvray

Description: This is a lightly honeyed wine with attractive almond and apple fruits. It comes from vines owned by the Saget family since 2002. With final crisp acidity and a tangy texture, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Château de la Mulonnière M de Mulonnière
Name: Saget la Perrière 2015 Château de la Mulonnière M de Mulonnière Chenin Blanc (Anjou)

Description: Dusty white-fruit aromas are generic. This fuller-bodied Chenin Blanc tastes of apple and acid-driven salt and brine.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alfredo Roca 2016 Fincas Chenin Blanc (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: True ice wines are a rarity in the Northwest. This one brings honeyed aromas of dried pineapple and mango that draw you into the glass. The flavors are sweet and rich but still manage to remain light on their feet. It's a perfect end to any meal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kiona 2016 Estate Grown Ice Wine Chenin Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: Winemaker: Johan Joubert. Notes of peach, apricot, melon and orange preserves abound on the nose and mouth of this rich, yet not overdone, wine. There's a bit of weight to the midpalate, countered by ample acidity and toasty woodspice that picks up the medium-length finish. It's certainly approachable and delicious now, but should continue to hold and develop well through 2022.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Johan Joubert 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild Granite Selection Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Winemaker: Sebastian Beaumont. It's hard not to like this wine. Initial aromas of clean yet ripe melon, yellow apple, sweet citrus and peach tones are upfront on the nose and carry through to the satisfying palate. The sweetness is countered by great acidic lift, with a saline minerality that lingers on the long, mouthwatering finish. It's hard to resist now, but it should continue to age well through 2022, and likely even beyond.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Beaumont 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild Demi-Sec Chenin Blanc (Bot River)

Description: Winemaker: Pierre Wahl. This wine is 100% barrel fermented and aged 14 months in new and second-fill French oak, but it holds it's wood well. It's rich and toasty at first, with scents of toasted brioche, apple skin, peach pit and pressed yellow flowers that carry through to the plush palate. Flavors of orange and melon rind, as well as superb acidity, help to cut through the wines richness alongside a subtle tannic texture. A wine that begs for food, this should age well through 2022.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Rijk's 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild CWG Chenin Blanc (Tulbagh)

Description: Orange-marmalade aromas set the stage for a rather full-bodied, dry and flavorful wine. Floral and fruity elements are counter-balanced by a tangy texture and subtle mineral accents. A classic of the type, it has a lot of personality, a great presence on the palate and a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2016 Dry Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first Chenin Blanc from this up-and-coming winery. All native yeast fermented and aged in stainless steel, the aromas pop, with notes of pear, apple, lees and melon. Sleek in style, it brings a sense of brightness and purity of flavor and bright acids. Very varietally correct, it's a compelling example of Chenin in the state. Pair it with food to see it at its best.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: W.T. Vintners 2016 Stoneridge Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: As effusive in flavor as a bowl full of orchard fruits, this wine exudes fresh apple, melon and spearmint aromas backed by ripe yet crisp flavors that carry a vein of apple blossoms. It's not sweet, but it has a pleasant softness around the edges of the mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Muddy Boot 2015 Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: Winemaker: Teddy Hall. This is a superrich and opulent expression of Chenin, with loads of woody influence throughout. The bouquet offers oodles of wood-grilled apple and baking spice  aromas, which carry through to the toasty, mouthfilling palate. Flavors of spiced orange peel and creamed melon help in fleshing out the palate, while the finish reverts back to endless oaky spice.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Teddy Hall 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Hendrik Biebouw Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh lime peel and kumquat aromas meet with lemongrass and a slightly yeasty touch on this bottling. Flavors are very tight and crisp, with citrus peel and wet riverstone. It's not an overly complex wine, but its freshness is compelling and lasts long once opened.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Zanoli 2016 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Winemaker: Andrea Mullineux. This is a rich and slightly oxidative expression of Chenin, with notes of dried straw, waxy melon, orange pith and toasted apple skin throughout. It's medium in weight, with an opulent, flat-feeling mouthfeel that's not quite fully lifted through the close. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Mullineux 2014 Cape Winemakers Guild Trifecta Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented and aged in concrete eggs, this wine brings unusual aromas of grape skins and grape nuts that lead to dry and leesy fruit flavors. It's a unique interpretation of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: J. Bookwalter 2016 Willard Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of overripe, slightly bruised red apple, ale and apple skin are at the fore. It brings a spritz to the off-dry apple-juice flavors, seeming to have not fully settled into the glass.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kiona 2016 Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is rich with smooth ripe fruit that give the impression that it is off dry. In fact, it is the intensity of the fruit that is the driving force behind the wine. With acidity strongly in the background, there is a crisp element to this fine lemon and apricot-flavored wine. Drink from 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Gaudrelle 2015 Clos le Vigneau  (Vouvray)

Description: This single vineyard wine has enormous potential. At this stage it is dry and not quite integrated. But with the rich fruitiness, the hints of yellow fruits and the tight mineral character, this wine will age extremely well. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Pichot 2015 Le Peu de la Moriette  (Vouvray)

Description: This dry wine shows hints of honey as well as pure sliced apple and white stone fruits. It is deliciously crisp, bright with acidity, almonds and a tangy texture. The wine is totally ready to drink in its fruity youth.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Pichot 2015 Coteau de la Biche Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This exciting, refreshing, superbly balanced wine has crisp green apple aromas and lively, almost electric lemon, lime and cucumber flavors. It's a great choice for lunch or with an appetizer course, since it's sure to get the conversation—as well as the appetite—going.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vinum 2015 Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Description: This sparkling wine shows the potential richness that can come from the combination of Chenin Blanc and bubbles. It's a nutty, spicy and ripe wine. At the same time, its acidity and tense structure give a cool crisp feel. This balance and tension are just right and the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Pichot 2014 Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: Well, who thought Chenin Blanc would end up in the Alentejo? Obviously not the guardian of the wine rules, which is why this classified as a mere table wine. However, the grape, perfumed and ripe in this warm climate, still weaves its magic to give a very fine wine with tropical fruit, a touch of honey and fine crisp acidity at the end. Drink this wine from late 2017.                      Roger Voss
Name: Ribafreixo 2016 Connections Chenin Blanc (Portuguese Table Wine)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rothrock Vineyard provides the fruit for this wine that was fermented and aged in neutral French oak. The aromas are light, with notes of herb, chamomile, green apple and spice. It's medium bodied, backed by vibrant acidity that carries through the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2016 Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Medium-bodied and thickly layered, this estate-grown wine shows more concentration and ripeness than it actually has, its acidity underlying a blanket of rich apple and banana flavor. It finishes crisp and clean.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ballentine 2016 Betty's Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Apple skin and white peach flavors and a smooth, rather rich mouthfeel lend quite a bit of personality to this unusually low-alcohol wine. It tastes a touch sweet, or at least quite ripe, but is balanced by tangy acidity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ironstone 2015 Chenin Blanc (California)

Description: This stylish wine is tight, crisp and with fine intense acidity. Its apple fruitiness is bright, delicious and refreshing. With its lively aftertaste, this is ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Gaudrelle NV Vigneau Brut  (Vouvray)

Description: This off-dry character is a hard style to work well. This wine succeeds because it has kept a dry background as well as strong minerality, so the almond-perfumed character of the wine is beautifully restrained and delicate. Drink the wine from 2019.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Montfort 2015 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Description: This wood aged Chenin Blanc has a strongly oxidative character. It has lost its fruit in favor of grilled almonds, toast and intense acidity. Drink this mature wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Chaintres 2013 Clos des Oratoriens  (Saumur)

Description: A medium-sweet wine, this offers crisp apples as well as touch of honey. It has attractive acidity bringing the texture of the Chenin Blanc into great focus. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Foucher-Lebrun 2015 La Vigne des Sablons Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are vibrant, with notes of dried pineapple and brown sugar. The palate is sweet but maintains a sleek well-balanced styling.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kiona 2015 Fortunate Sun Late Harvest Chenin Blanc (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of white peach and flowers are followed by elegantly styled, off-dry stone-fruit flavors. It provides intrigue but doesn't entirely deliver.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Columbia Crest 2015 Reserve Chenin Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Beaumont's Hope Marguerite is always a stunner. The 2015 bottling opens with forward fynbos and baking-spice aromas that are supported by notes of red apple, orange blossom and fennel. The medium-weight mouthfeel boasts rich flavors of spiced citrus and apple pie, with waves of toasted spice and honeyed almond dancing through the long, evolving finish. It's a complex wine that should drink well through 2022.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Beaumont 2015 Hope Marguerite Chenin Blanc (Bot River)

Description: Silky and voluptuous, this is a compelling example of the rare variety being able to shine in the Napa Valley when put in the right hands. From a small vintage (only the second for this wine), it shines in peach, green apple and honey flavors, chased by crisp acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lang & Reed 2015 Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a rich and seductive yet well-balanced Chenin, offering ripe notes of stone fruit and melon that are framed by threads of lanolin, beeswax, graphite and fynbos. The medium-weight palate is bright and clean, as fresh citrus and green fruit tones are partnered with lively acidity and a pithy citrus and melon-rind flavor on the ensuring finish. Drink now–2020.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: DeMorgenzon 2013 The Divas Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Aromas of vanilla and buttered popcorn are upfront on the nose of this wine, suggesting decadence ahead, with additional scents of ripe pear, fig and honeydew at the core. The medium-weight palate is smooth and mouthfilling, but with ample acidity to lift the wine's richness. Notes of honeycomb and sweet spice linger long on the finish. Drink now–2020.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Remhoogte 2014 Reserve Honeybunch Chenin Blanc (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

Description: This rich and seductive pour leads with intense aromas of buttered toast, candied nuts, honeydew and grilled peach, with a touch of orangy citrus. The medium-weight mouthfeel is plush yet balanced by medium acidity that lends nice vibrancy to the mouthfeel and spicy finish. Drink now–2019.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2014 Radio Lazarus Single Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: This is a concentrated, fairly full and lush Chenin, rich in toasty oak and vanilla cream as well as notes of baked apple pie and sweet orange. The medium-weight palate is mouthfilling and satisfying, with ample acidity to lift the decadent flavors. Notes of clove, anise and toasted nuts mingle on the lingering finish. Drink now–2019.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Spier 2014 21 Gables Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: This is a lush and okay expression, with forward notes of wood-grilled apple, buttered toast, caramel corn and honeydew on the nose and mouth. The mouthfeel is round and creamy, with ample acidity to cut the wine's weight and dense, rich flavors. Flavors of honeycomb and sweet spice hang on to the close. Drink now–2019.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Bellingham 2015 The Bernard Series Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Coastal Region)

Description: This is a round and rich wine, with notes of wood-grilled apple, guava and toasted challah. Smooth and lush in feel, ripe peach and tropical tones drive the palate, while hints of honeysuckle and baking spice unfold on the finish. Ample acidity keeps the wine's weight in check. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Oldenburg 2014 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Low-intensity aromas of grilled apple, quince and pear purée dance on the bouquet, with a faint hint of straw in the background. Bright acidity and a pronounced citrus flavor results in a fresh and accessible mouthfeel, while the finish offers touches of toasted challah and clove. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Avondale 2014 Anima Chenin Blanc (Paarl)

Description: Attractive, toasty scents of matchstick, grilled apple and peach pit lead the bouquet of this rich yet balanced white. A honeycomb accent weaves throughout the nose and mouth, alongside flavors of yellow peach, melon and apple. The creamy palate is refreshed by ample acidity, while the finish boasts seductive notes of baking spice. Drink now–2019.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Raats Family 2015 Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: Producers in Cahors are re-introducing Chenin Blanc back to its original home. That it is a happy grape in a Cahors vineyard is proved by this deliciously ripe and perfumed wine. It is full with a balance with crispness and white and yellow fruits. It could age another few months, so drink from 2018.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Chenin de Mercuès Chenin Blanc (Côtes du Lot)

Description: Rich, slightly oxidized notes of red apple and yellow melon are laced with accents of bitter orange peel and herbal tones. Medium weight, with a softness to the midpalate, it's enlivened by ample acidic lift. Flavors of toasted apple and pear fade into notes of sweet spice and beeswax on the finish. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Vins d'Orrance 2013 Kāma Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Toasted hazelnut, Honeycomb cereal, apple pie and orange cream lead the powerful nose of this decadent Chenin. The medium-weight palate is lush and smooth in texture, with ample acidity to counter the ripe baked apple and honeydew fruit. Toasted, buttered nuts and sweet spice flavors abound on the finish. Drink now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Alheit 2014 Magnetic North Mountain Makstok Chenin Blanc (Olifants River)

Description: Soft scents of white flowers and honeysuckle grace the lemon-lime and green apple fruit tones on the nose and mouth. It's well-balanced and accessible, with bright, citrusy acidity and a touch of pithy texture to the close. Drink now–2018.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Beaumont 2016 Chenin Blanc (Bot River)

Description: Soft Honeycomb cereal, toasted apple skin and pear lead the nose of this accessible wine, with pleasant hints of fresh herbs. The palate is clean and light on its feet, with vibrant acidity that kicks up the ripe apple, orange and white melon flavors. Drink this balanced beauty now.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Eikeboom 2016 Bush Vine Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)
